systemd.execIndex  索引· Directives  指令systemd 255

Name 名称

systemd.exec — Execution environment configuration
systemd.exec — 执行环境配置

Synopsis 概要

service.service, socket.socket, mount.mount, swap.swap

Description¶ 描述

Unit configuration files for services, sockets, mount points, and swap devices share a subset of configuration options which define the execution environment of spawned processes.
服务、套接字、挂载点和交换设备的单元配置文件共享一组配置选项，这些选项定义了生成进程的执行环境。

This man page lists the configuration options shared by these four unit types. See systemd.unit(5) for the common options of all unit configuration files, and systemd.service(5), systemd.socket(5), systemd.swap(5), and systemd.mount(5) for more information on the specific unit configuration files. The execution specific configuration options are configured in the [Service], [Socket], [Mount], or [Swap] sections, depending on the unit type.
本手册列出了这四种单元类型共享的配置选项。有关所有单元配置文件的常见选项，请参阅 systemd.unit(5)，有关特定单元配置文件的更多信息，请参阅 systemd.service(5)，systemd.socket(5)，systemd.swap(5)和 systemd.mount(5)。执行特定配置选项在[Service]、[Socket]、[Mount]或[Swap]部分中配置，具体取决于单元类型。

In addition, options which control resources through Linux Control Groups (cgroups) are listed in systemd.resource-control(5). Those options complement options listed here.
此外，通过 Linux 控制组（cgroups）控制资源的选项列在 systemd.resource-control(5)中。这些选项补充了此处列出的选项。

Implicit Dependencies¶ 隐式依赖关系

A few execution parameters result in additional, automatic dependencies to be added:
一些执行参数会导致自动添加额外的依赖项：

  • Units with WorkingDirectory=, RootDirectory=, RootImage=, RuntimeDirectory=, StateDirectory=, CacheDirectory=, LogsDirectory= or ConfigurationDirectory= set automatically gain dependencies of type Requires= and After= on all mount units required to access the specified paths. This is equivalent to having them listed explicitly in RequiresMountsFor=.
    具有 WorkingDirectory= ， RootDirectory= ， RootImage= ， RuntimeDirectory= ， StateDirectory= ， CacheDirectory= ， LogsDirectory= 或 ConfigurationDirectory= 设置的单元会自动获得对所有需要访问指定路径的挂载单元的 Requires= 和 After= 类型的依赖项。这相当于在 RequiresMountsFor= 中明确列出它们。

  • Similarly, units with PrivateTmp= enabled automatically get mount unit dependencies for all mounts required to access /tmp/ and /var/tmp/. They will also gain an automatic After= dependency on systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service(8).
    同样，启用 PrivateTmp= 的单元会自动获得访问 /tmp/ 和 /var/tmp/ 所需的所有挂载的挂载单元依赖项。它们还会对 systemd-tmpfiles-setup.service(8)获得自动 After= 依赖项。

  • Units whose standard output or error output is connected to journal or kmsg (or their combinations with console output, see below) automatically acquire dependencies of type After= on systemd-journald.socket.
    将标准输出或错误输出连接到 journal 或 kmsg （或其与控制台输出的组合）的单元会自动在 systemd-journald.socket 上获取类型为 After= 的依赖项。

  • Units using LogNamespace= will automatically gain ordering and requirement dependencies on the two socket units associated with systemd-journald@.service instances.
    使用 LogNamespace= 的单元将自动在与 systemd-journald@.service 实例关联的两个套接字单元上获得排序和需求依赖项。

Paths¶ 路径

The following settings may be used to change a service's view of the filesystem. Please note that the paths must be absolute and must not contain a ".." path component.
以下设置可用于更改服务对文件系统的视图。请注意，路径必须是绝对的，且不能包含“ .. ”路径组件。

ExecSearchPath=¶

Takes a colon separated list of absolute paths relative to which the executable used by the Exec*= (e.g. ExecStart=, ExecStop=, etc.) properties can be found. ExecSearchPath= overrides $PATH if $PATH is not supplied by the user through Environment=, EnvironmentFile= or PassEnvironment=. Assigning an empty string removes previous assignments and setting ExecSearchPath= to a value multiple times will append to the previous setting.
接受以冒号分隔的绝对路径列表，可相对于其中找到由 Exec*= （例如 ExecStart= ， ExecStop= 等）属性使用的可执行文件。如果用户未通过 Environment= ， EnvironmentFile= 或 PassEnvironment= 提供 $PATH ，则 ExecSearchPath= 将覆盖 $PATH 。将空字符串分配给一个属性会删除先前的分配，并且多次将 ExecSearchPath= 设置为一个值将追加到先前的设置中。

Added in version 250.
添加于版本 250。

WorkingDirectory=¶

Takes a directory path relative to the service's root directory specified by RootDirectory=, or the special value "~". Sets the working directory for executed processes. If set to "~", the home directory of the user specified in User= is used. If not set, defaults to the root directory when systemd is running as a system instance and the respective user's home directory if run as user. If the setting is prefixed with the "-" character, a missing working directory is not considered fatal. If RootDirectory=/RootImage= is not set, then WorkingDirectory= is relative to the root of the system running the service manager. Note that setting this parameter might result in additional dependencies to be added to the unit (see above).
获取相对于由 RootDirectory= 指定的服务根目录的目录路径，或特殊值" ~ "。设置执行进程的工作目录。如果设置为" ~ "，则使用 User= 中指定用户的主目录。如果未设置，则在 systemd 作为系统实例运行时默认为根目录，如果作为用户运行则为相应用户的主目录。如果设置以" - "字符为前缀，则缺少工作目录不被视为致命错误。如果 RootDirectory= / RootImage= 未设置，则 WorkingDirectory= 相对于运行服务管理器的系统根目录。请注意，设置此参数可能导致需要添加其他依赖项到单元（请参阅上文）。

RootDirectory=¶

Takes a directory path relative to the host's root directory (i.e. the root of the system running the service manager). Sets the root directory for executed processes, with the chroot(2) system call. If this is used, it must be ensured that the process binary and all its auxiliary files are available in the chroot() jail. Note that setting this parameter might result in additional dependencies to be added to the unit (see above).
获取相对于主机根目录（即运行服务管理器的系统根目录）的目录路径。使用 chroot(2) 系统调用设置执行进程的根目录。如果使用此选项，必须确保进程二进制文件及其所有辅助文件在 chroot() jail 中可用。请注意，设置此参数可能导致需要添加其他依赖项到单元（请参阅上文）。

The MountAPIVFS= and PrivateUsers= settings are particularly useful in conjunction with RootDirectory=. For details, see below.
MountAPIVFS= 和 PrivateUsers= 设置与 RootDirectory= 结合使用时特别有用。详情请参见下文。

If RootDirectory=/RootImage= are used together with NotifyAccess= the notification socket is automatically mounted from the host into the root environment, to ensure the notification interface can work correctly.
如果 RootDirectory= / RootImage= 与 NotifyAccess= 一起使用，则通知套接字将自动从主机挂载到根环境中，以确保通知接口能正常工作。

Note that services using RootDirectory=/RootImage= will not be able to log via the syslog or journal protocols to the host logging infrastructure, unless the relevant sockets are mounted from the host, specifically:
请注意，使用 RootDirectory= / RootImage= 的服务将无法通过 syslog 或 journal 协议记录到主机日志基础设施，除非相关套接字从主机挂载，具体如下：

The host's os-release(5) file will be made available for the service (read-only) as /run/host/os-release. It will be updated automatically on soft reboot (see: systemd-soft-reboot.service(8)), in case the service is configured to survive it.
主机的 os-release(5) 文件将作为 /run/host/os-release 提供给服务（只读）。在软重启时将自动更新（参见：systemd-soft-reboot.service(8)），如果服务配置为在软重启时保留。

Example 1. Mounting logging sockets into root environment
示例 1. 将日志套接字挂载到根环境

BindReadOnlyPaths=/dev/log /run/systemd/journal/socket /run/systemd/journal/stdout

This option is only available for system services, or for services running in per-user instances of the service manager in which case PrivateUsers= is implicitly enabled (requires unprivileged user namespaces support to be enabled in the kernel via the "kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=" sysctl).
此选项仅适用于系统服务，或者在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务，此时 PrivateUsers= 将被隐式启用（需要在内核中通过 " kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone= " sysctl 启用非特权用户命名空间支持）。

RootImage=¶

Takes a path to a block device node or regular file as argument. This call is similar to RootDirectory= however mounts a file system hierarchy from a block device node or loopback file instead of a directory. The device node or file system image file needs to contain a file system without a partition table, or a file system within an MBR/MS-DOS or GPT partition table with only a single Linux-compatible partition, or a set of file systems within a GPT partition table that follows the Discoverable Partitions Specification.
接受块设备节点或常规文件路径作为参数。此调用类似于 RootDirectory= ，但是挂载的是来自块设备节点或回环文件的文件系统层次结构，而不是目录。设备节点或文件系统镜像文件需要包含一个没有分区表的文件系统，或者一个仅包含单个 Linux 兼容分区的 MBR/MS-DOS 或 GPT 分区表内的文件系统，或者遵循可发现分区规范的 GPT 分区表内的一组文件系统。

When DevicePolicy= is set to "closed" or "strict", or set to "auto" and DeviceAllow= is set, then this setting adds /dev/loop-control with rw mode, "block-loop" and "block-blkext" with rwm mode to DeviceAllow=. See systemd.resource-control(5) for the details about DevicePolicy= or DeviceAllow=. Also, see PrivateDevices= below, as it may change the setting of DevicePolicy=.
当 DevicePolicy= 设置为" closed "或" strict "，或设置为" auto "并且 DeviceAllow= 被设置时，此设置会将 /dev/loop-control 与 rw 模式，" block-loop "和" block-blkext "与 rwm 模式添加到 DeviceAllow= 。有关 DevicePolicy= 或 DeviceAllow= 的详细信息，请参阅 systemd.resource-control(5)。另请参阅下面的 PrivateDevices= ，因为它可能会更改 DevicePolicy= 的设置。

Units making use of RootImage= automatically gain an After= dependency on systemd-udevd.service.
使用 RootImage= 的单元会自动对 systemd-udevd.service 增加 After= 依赖。

The host's os-release(5) file will be made available for the service (read-only) as /run/host/os-release. It will be updated automatically on soft reboot (see: systemd-soft-reboot.service(8)), in case the service is configured to survive it.
主机的 os-release(5) 文件将作为 /run/host/os-release 提供给服务（只读）。在软重启时（参见：systemd-soft-reboot.service(8)），文件将自动更新，如果服务被配置为在软重启后继续运行。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 233. 添加于版本 233。

RootImageOptions=¶

Takes a comma-separated list of mount options that will be used on disk images specified by RootImage=. Optionally a partition name can be prefixed, followed by colon, in case the image has multiple partitions, otherwise partition name "root" is implied. Options for multiple partitions can be specified in a single line with space separators. Assigning an empty string removes previous assignments. Duplicated options are ignored. For a list of valid mount options, please refer to mount(8).
接受逗号分隔的挂载选项列表，这些选项将用于由 RootImage= 指定的磁盘映像。可选地，可以在前面加上分区名称，后跟冒号，以防映像有多个分区，否则将假定分区名称为 " root "。可以在单行中使用空格分隔符指定多个分区的选项。将空字符串分配给选项将删除先前的分配。重复的选项将被忽略。有关有效的挂载选项列表，请参阅 mount(8)。

Valid partition names follow the Discoverable Partitions Specification: root, usr, home, srv, esp, xbootldr, tmp, var.
有效的分区名称遵循可发现分区规范: root , usr , home , srv , esp , xbootldr , tmp , var .

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 247. 添加于版本 247。

RootEphemeral=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If enabled, executed processes will run in an ephemeral copy of the root directory or root image. The ephemeral copy is placed in /var/lib/systemd/ephemeral-trees/ while the service is active and is cleaned up when the service is stopped or restarted. If RootDirectory= is used and the root directory is a subvolume, the ephemeral copy will be created by making a snapshot of the subvolume.
接受一个布尔参数。如果启用，执行的进程将在根目录或根镜像的临时副本中运行。临时副本放置在 /var/lib/systemd/ephemeral-trees/ 中，当服务处于活动状态时，将在停止或重新启动服务时进行清理。如果使用 RootDirectory= 并且根目录是一个子卷，临时副本将通过对子卷进行快照来创建。

To make sure making ephemeral copies can be made efficiently, the root directory or root image should be located on the same filesystem as /var/lib/systemd/ephemeral-trees/. When using RootEphemeral= with root directories, btrfs(5) should be used as the filesystem and the root directory should ideally be a subvolume which systemd can snapshot to make the ephemeral copy. For root images, a filesystem with support for reflinks should be used to ensure an efficient ephemeral copy.
为了确保可以有效地创建临时副本，根目录或根镜像应位于与 /var/lib/systemd/ephemeral-trees/ 相同的文件系统上。在使用 RootEphemeral= 与根目录时，应使用 btrfs(5)作为文件系统，并且根目录理想情况下应为 systemd 可以快照以创建临时副本的子卷。对于根镜像，应使用支持 reflinks 的文件系统以确保高效的临时副本。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 254. 在版本 254 中添加。

RootHash=¶

Takes a data integrity (dm-verity) root hash specified in hexadecimal, or the path to a file containing a root hash in ASCII hexadecimal format. This option enables data integrity checks using dm-verity, if the used image contains the appropriate integrity data (see above) or if RootVerity= is used. The specified hash must match the root hash of integrity data, and is usually at least 256 bits (and hence 64 formatted hexadecimal characters) long (in case of SHA256 for example). If this option is not specified, but the image file carries the "user.verity.roothash" extended file attribute (see xattr(7)), then the root hash is read from it, also as formatted hexadecimal characters. If the extended file attribute is not found (or is not supported by the underlying file system), but a file with the .roothash suffix is found next to the image file, bearing otherwise the same name (except if the image has the .raw suffix, in which case the root hash file must not have it in its name), the root hash is read from it and automatically used, also as formatted hexadecimal characters.
采用十六进制指定的数据完整性（dm-verity）根哈希，或包含根哈希的 ASCII 十六进制格式文件的路径。如果使用的映像包含适当的完整性数据（见上文）或使用 RootVerity= ，则此选项启用使用 dm-verity 进行数据完整性检查。指定的哈希值必须与完整性数据的根哈希匹配，通常至少为 256 位（因此为 64 个格式化的十六进制字符）长（例如 SHA256 的情况）。如果未指定此选项，但映像文件携带“ user.verity.roothash ”扩展文件属性（请参阅 xattr(7)），则也会从中读取根哈希，同样作为格式化的十六进制字符。如果未找到扩展文件属性（或底层文件系统不支持），但在映像文件旁边找到带有 .roothash 后缀的文件，其名称除了映像具有 .raw 后缀的情况外，根哈希也会从中读取并自动使用，同样作为格式化的十六进制字符。

If the disk image contains a separate /usr/ partition it may also be Verity protected, in which case the root hash may configured via an extended attribute "user.verity.usrhash" or a .usrhash file adjacent to the disk image. There's currently no option to configure the root hash for the /usr/ file system via the unit file directly.
如果磁盘映像包含一个单独的 /usr/ 分区，那么它可能也受到 Verity 保护，此时根哈希可以通过扩展属性 " user.verity.usrhash " 或者与磁盘映像相邻的 .usrhash 文件进行配置。目前无法直接通过单元文件配置 /usr/ 文件系统的根哈希。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 246. 添加于版本 246。

RootHashSignature=¶

Takes a PKCS7 signature of the RootHash= option as a path to a DER-encoded signature file, or as an ASCII base64 string encoding of a DER-encoded signature prefixed by "base64:". The dm-verity volume will only be opened if the signature of the root hash is valid and signed by a public key present in the kernel keyring. If this option is not specified, but a file with the .roothash.p7s suffix is found next to the image file, bearing otherwise the same name (except if the image has the .raw suffix, in which case the signature file must not have it in its name), the signature is read from it and automatically used.
以 PKCS7 签名的 RootHash= 选项作为 DER 编码签名文件的路径，或者作为 DER 编码签名的 ASCII base64 字符串编码，前缀为 " base64: "。只有根哈希的签名有效且由内核密钥环中存在的公钥签名时，dm-verity 卷才会被打开。如果未指定此选项，但在图像文件旁边找到具有 .roothash.p7s 后缀的文件，其名称除了图像具有 .raw 后缀外，签名文件的名称不能包含该后缀，则会从中读取签名并自动使用。

If the disk image contains a separate /usr/ partition it may also be Verity protected, in which case the signature for the root hash may configured via a .usrhash.p7s file adjacent to the disk image. There's currently no option to configure the root hash signature for the /usr/ via the unit file directly.
如果磁盘映像包含一个单独的 /usr/ 分区，那么它也可能受到 Verity 保护，此时根哈希的签名可以通过与磁盘映像相邻的 .usrhash.p7s 文件进行配置。目前没有直接通过单元文件配置根哈希签名的选项。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，不支持在服务管理器的用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 246. 添加于版本 246。

RootVerity=¶

Takes the path to a data integrity (dm-verity) file. This option enables data integrity checks using dm-verity, if RootImage= is used and a root-hash is passed and if the used image itself does not contain the integrity data. The integrity data must be matched by the root hash. If this option is not specified, but a file with the .verity suffix is found next to the image file, bearing otherwise the same name (except if the image has the .raw suffix, in which case the verity data file must not have it in its name), the verity data is read from it and automatically used.
获取数据完整性（dm-verity）文件的路径。如果使用 RootImage= 并传递根哈希，并且使用的映像本身不包含完整性数据，则此选项启用使用 dm-verity 进行数据完整性检查。完整性数据必须与根哈希匹配。如果未指定此选项，但在映像文件旁边找到具有 .verity 后缀的文件，其名称除了映像具有 .raw 后缀外，verity 数据将从中读取并自动使用。

This option is supported only for disk images that contain a single file system, without an enveloping partition table. Images that contain a GPT partition table should instead include both root file system and matching Verity data in the same image, implementing the Discoverable Partitions Specification.
该选项仅支持包含单个文件系统、不包含包围分区表的磁盘映像。包含 GPT 分区表的映像应该在同一映像中包含根文件系统和匹配的 Verity 数据，实现可发现分区规范。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 246. 添加于版本 246。

RootImagePolicy=, MountImagePolicy=, ExtensionImagePolicy=¶
RootImagePolicy= ， MountImagePolicy= ， ExtensionImagePolicy= ¶

Takes an image policy string as per systemd.image-policy(7) to use when mounting the disk images (DDI) specified in RootImage=, MountImage=, ExtensionImage=, respectively. If not specified the following policy string is the default for RootImagePolicy= and MountImagePolicy:
接受一个映像策略字符串，如 systemd.image-policy(7) 中所述，用于挂载指定的磁盘映像（DDI），分别为 RootImage= ， MountImage= ， ExtensionImage= 。如果未指定，则以下策略字符串是 RootImagePolicy= 和 MountImagePolicy 的默认值：

root=verity+signed+encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        usr=verity+signed+encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        home=encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        srv=encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        tmp=encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        var=encrypted+unprotected+absent

The default policy for ExtensionImagePolicy= is:
ExtensionImagePolicy= 的默认策略是：

root=verity+signed+encrypted+unprotected+absent: \
        usr=verity+signed+encrypted+unprotected+absent

Added in version 254. 在版本 254 中添加。

MountAPIVFS=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If on, a private mount namespace for the unit's processes is created and the API file systems /proc/, /sys/, /dev/ and /run/ (as an empty "tmpfs") are mounted inside of it, unless they are already mounted. Note that this option has no effect unless used in conjunction with RootDirectory=/RootImage= as these four mounts are generally mounted in the host anyway, and unless the root directory is changed, the private mount namespace will be a 1:1 copy of the host's, and include these four mounts. Note that the /dev/ file system of the host is bind mounted if this option is used without PrivateDevices=. To run the service with a private, minimal version of /dev/, combine this option with PrivateDevices=.
接受一个布尔参数。如果打开，将为该单元的进程创建一个私有挂载命名空间，并在其中挂载 API 文件系统 /proc/ ， /sys/ ， /dev/ 和 /run/ （作为空的 " tmpfs "），除非它们已经被挂载。请注意，除非与 RootDirectory= / RootImage= 一起使用，否则此选项无效，因为这四个挂载通常已在主机上挂载，并且除非更改根目录，否则私有挂载命名空间将是主机的 1:1 复制，并包括这四个挂载。请注意，如果在没有 PrivateDevices= 的情况下使用此选项，则会将主机的 /dev/ 文件系统绑定挂载。要使用私有、精简版本的 /dev/ 运行服务，请将此选项与 PrivateDevices= 结合使用。

In order to allow propagating mounts at runtime in a safe manner, /run/systemd/propagate/ on the host will be used to set up new mounts, and /run/host/incoming/ in the private namespace will be used as an intermediate step to store them before being moved to the final mount point.
为了以安全的方式在运行时允许传播挂载，将使用主机上的 /run/systemd/propagate/ 来设置新的挂载点，并将私有命名空间中的 /run/host/incoming/ 用作中间步骤，将它们存储在那里，然后移动到最终的挂载点。

Added in version 233. 添加于版本 233。

ProtectProc=¶

Takes one of "noaccess", "invisible", "ptraceable" or "default" (which it defaults to). When set, this controls the "hidepid=" mount option of the "procfs" instance for the unit that controls which directories with process metainformation (/proc/PID) are visible and accessible: when set to "noaccess" the ability to access most of other users' process metadata in /proc/ is taken away for processes of the service. When set to "invisible" processes owned by other users are hidden from /proc/. If "ptraceable" all processes that cannot be ptrace()'ed by a process are hidden to it. If "default" no restrictions on /proc/ access or visibility are made. For further details see The /proc Filesystem. It is generally recommended to run most system services with this option set to "invisible". This option is implemented via file system namespacing, and thus cannot be used with services that shall be able to install mount points in the host file system hierarchy. Note that the root user is unaffected by this option, so to be effective it has to be used together with User= or DynamicUser=yes, and also without the "CAP_SYS_PTRACE" capability, which also allows a process to bypass this feature. It cannot be used for services that need to access metainformation about other users' processes. This option implies MountAPIVFS=.
取其中一个 " noaccess ", " invisible ", " ptraceable " 或 " default "（默认为此）。设置后，此控制 " hidepid= " 挂载选项的 " procfs " 实例，用于控制控制哪些具有进程元信息（ /proc/PID ）的目录可见和可访问：当设置为 " noaccess " 时，服务的进程将无法访问 /proc/ 中大多数其他用户的进程元数据。当设置为 " invisible " 时，其他用户拥有的进程将从 /proc/ 中隐藏。如果设置为 " ptraceable "，则无法通过 ptrace() 进程隐藏所有无法 ptrace() 的进程。如果设置为 " default "，则不对 /proc/ 的访问或可见性进行任何限制。有关详细信息，请参阅 /proc 文件系统。通常建议将大多数系统服务的此选项设置为 " invisible "。此选项通过文件系统命名空间实现，因此无法与应能够在主机文件系统层次结构中安装挂载点的服务一起使用。请注意，此选项不会影响 root 用户，因此要使其生效，必须与 User= 或 DynamicUser=yes 一起使用，同时不使用 " CAP_SYS_PTRACE " 能力，该能力还允许进程绕过此功能。 不能用于需要访问其他用户进程元信息的服务。此选项意味着 MountAPIVFS= 。

If the kernel doesn't support per-mount point hidepid= mount options this setting remains without effect, and the unit's processes will be able to access and see other process as if the option was not used.
如果内核不支持每个挂载点 hidepid= 挂载选项，则此设置将无效，并且单元的进程将能够访问和查看其他进程，就好像未使用该选项一样。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 247. 添加在版本 247 中。

ProcSubset=¶

Takes one of "all" (the default) and "pid". If "pid", all files and directories not directly associated with process management and introspection are made invisible in the /proc/ file system configured for the unit's processes. This controls the "subset=" mount option of the "procfs" instance for the unit. For further details see The /proc Filesystem. Note that Linux exposes various kernel APIs via /proc/, which are made unavailable with this setting. Since these APIs are used frequently this option is useful only in a few, specific cases, and is not suitable for most non-trivial programs.
取其中之一为“ all ”（默认）和“ pid ”。如果“ pid ”，则所有与进程管理和内省无直接关联的文件和目录在为单元的进程配置的 /proc/ 文件系统中将被隐藏。这控制了单元的“ subset= ”挂载选项的“ procfs ”实例。有关详细信息，请参阅 /proc 文件系统。请注意，Linux 通过 /proc/ 公开各种内核 API，这些 API 在此设置下不可用。由于这些 API 经常被使用，因此此选项仅在少数特定情况下有用，并且不适用于大多数非平凡程序。

Much like ProtectProc= above, this is implemented via file system mount namespacing, and hence the same restrictions apply: it is only available to system services, it disables mount propagation to the host mount table, and it implies MountAPIVFS=. Also, like ProtectProc= this setting is gracefully disabled if the used kernel does not support the "subset=" mount option of "procfs".
与上述 ProtectProc= 非常相似，这是通过文件系统挂载命名空间实现的，因此相同的限制适用：它仅适用于系统服务，禁用对主机挂载表的挂载传播，并且意味着 MountAPIVFS= 。此外，与 ProtectProc= 一样，如果使用的内核不支持“ procfs ”的“ subset= ”挂载选项，则此设置会被优雅地禁用。

Added in version 247. 在版本 247 中添加。

BindPaths=, BindReadOnlyPaths=¶  BindPaths= ， BindReadOnlyPaths= ¶

Configures unit-specific bind mounts. A bind mount makes a particular file or directory available at an additional place in the unit's view of the file system. Any bind mounts created with this option are specific to the unit, and are not visible in the host's mount table. This option expects a whitespace separated list of bind mount definitions. Each definition consists of a colon-separated triple of source path, destination path and option string, where the latter two are optional. If only a source path is specified the source and destination is taken to be the same. The option string may be either "rbind" or "norbind" for configuring a recursive or non-recursive bind mount. If the destination path is omitted, the option string must be omitted too. Each bind mount definition may be prefixed with "-", in which case it will be ignored when its source path does not exist.
配置单元特定的绑定挂载。绑定挂载使特定文件或目录在单元对文件系统的视图中的其他位置可用。使用此选项创建的任何绑定挂载都特定于该单元，并且不会显示在主机的挂载表中。此选项期望以空格分隔的绑定挂载定义列表。每个定义由源路径、目标路径和选项字符串（后两者是可选的）组成，用冒号分隔，如果只指定源路径，则源和目标被视为相同。选项字符串可以是用于配置递归或非递归绑定挂载的 " rbind " 或 " norbind "。如果省略目标路径，则必须省略选项字符串。每个绑定挂载定义可能以 " - " 为前缀，这样当其源路径不存在时将被忽略。

BindPaths= creates regular writable bind mounts (unless the source file system mount is already marked read-only), while BindReadOnlyPaths= creates read-only bind mounts. These settings may be used more than once, each usage appends to the unit's list of bind mounts. If the empty string is assigned to either of these two options the entire list of bind mounts defined prior to this is reset. Note that in this case both read-only and regular bind mounts are reset, regardless which of the two settings is used.
BindPaths= 创建常规可写绑定挂载（除非源文件系统挂载已标记为只读），而 BindReadOnlyPaths= 创建只读绑定挂载。这些设置可以使用多次，每次使用都会附加到单元的绑定挂载列表中。如果将空字符串分配给这两个选项中的任何一个，则在此之前定义的所有绑定挂载列表都将被重置。请注意，在这种情况下，无论使用哪个设置，只读和常规绑定挂载都将被重置。

This option is particularly useful when RootDirectory=/RootImage= is used. In this case the source path refers to a path on the host file system, while the destination path refers to a path below the root directory of the unit.
当 RootDirectory= / RootImage= 时，此选项特别有用。在这种情况下，源路径指的是主机文件系统上的路径，而目标路径指的是单元根目录下的路径。

Note that the destination directory must exist or systemd must be able to create it. Thus, it is not possible to use those options for mount points nested underneath paths specified in InaccessiblePaths=, or under /home/ and other protected directories if ProtectHome=yes is specified. TemporaryFileSystem= with ":ro" or ProtectHome=tmpfs should be used instead.
请注意，目标目录必须存在，或者 systemd 必须能够创建它。因此，不可能将这些选项用于嵌套在 InaccessiblePaths= 指定的路径下面的挂载点，或者在 /home/ 和其他受保护目录下面，如果指定了 ProtectHome=yes 。应改用带有 " :ro " 或 ProtectHome=tmpfs 的 TemporaryFileSystem= 。

Added in version 233. 添加于版本 233。

MountImages=¶

This setting is similar to RootImage= in that it mounts a file system hierarchy from a block device node or loopback file, but the destination directory can be specified as well as mount options. This option expects a whitespace separated list of mount definitions. Each definition consists of a colon-separated tuple of source path and destination definitions, optionally followed by another colon and a list of mount options.
此设置类似于 RootImage= ，它从块设备节点或回环文件挂载文件系统层次结构，但目标目录可以指定以及挂载选项。此选项期望以空格分隔的挂载定义列表。每个定义由源路径和目标定义的冒号分隔的元组组成，可选地后跟另一个冒号和挂载选项列表。

Mount options may be defined as a single comma-separated list of options, in which case they will be implicitly applied to the root partition on the image, or a series of colon-separated tuples of partition name and mount options. Valid partition names and mount options are the same as for RootImageOptions= setting described above.
挂载选项可以定义为单个逗号分隔的选项列表，这样它们将隐式应用于镜像上的根分区，或者一系列由分区名称和挂载选项冒号分隔的元组。有效的分区名称和挂载选项与上述 RootImageOptions= 设置中描述的相同。

Each mount definition may be prefixed with "-", in which case it will be ignored when its source path does not exist. The source argument is a path to a block device node or regular file. If source or destination contain a ":", it needs to be escaped as "\:". The device node or file system image file needs to follow the same rules as specified for RootImage=. Any mounts created with this option are specific to the unit, and are not visible in the host's mount table.
每个挂载定义都可以以“ - ”为前缀，这样当其源路径不存在时将被忽略。源参数是一个块设备节点或常规文件的路径。如果源或目的地包含“ : ”，则需要转义为“ \: ”。设备节点或文件系统镜像文件需要遥相呼应 RootImage= 所指定的相同规则。使用此选项创建的任何挂载都特定于该单元，并不会出现在主机的挂载表中。

These settings may be used more than once, each usage appends to the unit's list of mount paths. If the empty string is assigned, the entire list of mount paths defined prior to this is reset.
这些设置可以多次使用，每次使用都会附加到单元的挂载路径列表中。如果分配空字符串，则会重置在此之前定义的所有挂载路径列表。

Note that the destination directory must exist or systemd must be able to create it. Thus, it is not possible to use those options for mount points nested underneath paths specified in InaccessiblePaths=, or under /home/ and other protected directories if ProtectHome=yes is specified.
请注意，目标目录必须存在，或者 systemd 必须能够创建它。因此，不可能将这些选项用于嵌套在 InaccessiblePaths= 指定的路径下的挂载点，或者在 /home/ 和其他受保护目录下使用 ProtectHome=yes 指定的路径。

When DevicePolicy= is set to "closed" or "strict", or set to "auto" and DeviceAllow= is set, then this setting adds /dev/loop-control with rw mode, "block-loop" and "block-blkext" with rwm mode to DeviceAllow=. See systemd.resource-control(5) for the details about DevicePolicy= or DeviceAllow=. Also, see PrivateDevices= below, as it may change the setting of DevicePolicy=.
当 DevicePolicy= 设置为 " closed " 或 " strict "，或设置为 " auto " 且设置了 DeviceAllow= ，则此设置将添加 /dev/loop-control 与 rw 模式，" block-loop " 和 " block-blkext " 与 rwm 模式到 DeviceAllow= 。有关 DevicePolicy= 或 DeviceAllow= 的详细信息，请参阅 systemd.resource-control(5)。另请参阅下面的 PrivateDevices= ，因为它可能会更改 DevicePolicy= 的设置。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 247. 在版本 247 中添加。

ExtensionImages=¶

This setting is similar to MountImages= in that it mounts a file system hierarchy from a block device node or loopback file, but instead of providing a destination path, an overlay will be set up. This option expects a whitespace separated list of mount definitions. Each definition consists of a source path, optionally followed by a colon and a list of mount options.
此设置类似于 MountImages= ，它会从块设备节点或回环文件挂载文件系统层次结构，但不是提供目标路径，而是设置一个叠加层。此选项期望一个以空格分隔的挂载定义列表。每个定义由一个源路径组成，可选地后跟一个冒号和一系列挂载选项。

A read-only OverlayFS will be set up on top of /usr/ and /opt/ hierarchies for sysext images and /etc/ hierarchy for confext images. The order in which the images are listed will determine the order in which the overlay is laid down: images specified first to last will result in overlayfs layers bottom to top.
为 sysext 镜像和 /opt/ 层次结构上设置一个只读的 OverlayFS，为 confext 镜像设置 /etc/ 层次结构。列出镜像的顺序将决定叠加层的放置顺序：从前到后指定的镜像将导致 overlayfs 层从底部到顶部。

Mount options may be defined as a single comma-separated list of options, in which case they will be implicitly applied to the root partition on the image, or a series of colon-separated tuples of partition name and mount options. Valid partition names and mount options are the same as for RootImageOptions= setting described above.
挂载选项可以定义为一个单独的逗号分隔的选项列表，这样它们将隐式应用于镜像上的根分区，或者一系列由分区名称和挂载选项组成的以冒号分隔的元组。有效的分区名称和挂载选项与上述 RootImageOptions= 设置中描述的相同。

Each mount definition may be prefixed with "-", in which case it will be ignored when its source path does not exist. The source argument is a path to a block device node or regular file. If the source path contains a ":", it needs to be escaped as "\:". The device node or file system image file needs to follow the same rules as specified for RootImage=. Any mounts created with this option are specific to the unit, and are not visible in the host's mount table.
每个挂载定义可能以“ - ”为前缀，这样当其源路径不存在时将被忽略。源参数是一个块设备节点或常规文件的路径。如果源路径包含“ : ”，则需要转义为“ \: ”。设备节点或文件系统镜像文件需要遵循与 RootImage= 指定的相同规则。使用此选项创建的任何挂载都特定于该单元，并且不会显示在主机的挂载表中。

These settings may be used more than once, each usage appends to the unit's list of image paths. If the empty string is assigned, the entire list of mount paths defined prior to this is reset.
这些设置可以多次使用，每次使用都会附加到单元的镜像路径列表中。如果分配空字符串，则会重置在此之前定义的所有挂载路径列表。

Each sysext image must carry a /usr/lib/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE file while each confext image must carry a /etc/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE file, with the appropriate metadata which matches RootImage=/RootDirectory= or the host. See: os-release(5). To disable the safety check that the extension-release file name matches the image file name, the x-systemd.relax-extension-release-check mount option may be appended.
每个 sysext 镜像必须携带一个 /usr/lib/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE 文件，而每个 confext 镜像必须携带一个 /etc/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE 文件，其中包含与 RootImage= / RootDirectory= 或主机相匹配的适当元数据。参见：os-release(5)。要禁用扩展-发布文件名与镜像文件名匹配的安全检查，可以附加 x-systemd.relax-extension-release-check 挂载选项。

When DevicePolicy= is set to "closed" or "strict", or set to "auto" and DeviceAllow= is set, then this setting adds /dev/loop-control with rw mode, "block-loop" and "block-blkext" with rwm mode to DeviceAllow=. See systemd.resource-control(5) for the details about DevicePolicy= or DeviceAllow=. Also, see PrivateDevices= below, as it may change the setting of DevicePolicy=.
当 DevicePolicy= 设置为 " closed " 或 " strict "，或设置为 " auto " 且设置了 DeviceAllow= 时，此设置将使用 rw 模式添加 /dev/loop-control ，使用 rwm 模式添加 " block-loop " 和 " block-blkext " 到 DeviceAllow= 。有关 DevicePolicy= 或 DeviceAllow= 的详细信息，请参阅 systemd.resource-control(5)。另请参阅下面的 PrivateDevices= ，因为它可能会更改 DevicePolicy= 的设置。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 248. 在版本 248 中添加。

ExtensionDirectories=¶

This setting is similar to BindReadOnlyPaths= in that it mounts a file system hierarchy from a directory, but instead of providing a destination path, an overlay will be set up. This option expects a whitespace separated list of source directories.
此设置类似于 BindReadOnlyPaths= ，它从目录挂载文件系统层次结构，但不提供目标路径，而是设置一个叠加。此选项期望一个以空格分隔的源目录列表。

A read-only OverlayFS will be set up on top of /usr/ and /opt/ hierarchies for sysext images and /etc/ hierarchy for confext images. The order in which the directories are listed will determine the order in which the overlay is laid down: directories specified first to last will result in overlayfs layers bottom to top.
在 sysext 图像和 confext 图像的 /usr/ 和 /opt/ 层次结构之上设置一个只读的 OverlayFS。列出目录的顺序将决定叠加层的放置顺序：从前到后指定的目录将导致 overlayfs 层从底部到顶部。

Each directory listed in ExtensionDirectories= may be prefixed with "-", in which case it will be ignored when its source path does not exist. Any mounts created with this option are specific to the unit, and are not visible in the host's mount table.
在 ExtensionDirectories= 中列出的每个目录可能以“ - ”为前缀，这样当其源路径不存在时将被忽略。使用此选项创建的任何挂载点都特定于该单元，并且不会出现在主机的挂载表中。

These settings may be used more than once, each usage appends to the unit's list of directories paths. If the empty string is assigned, the entire list of mount paths defined prior to this is reset.
这些设置可以多次使用，每次使用都会附加到单元的目录路径列表。如果分配空字符串，则会重置在此之前定义的所有挂载路径列表。

Each sysext directory must contain a /usr/lib/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE file while each confext directory must carry a /etc/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE file, with the appropriate metadata which matches RootImage=/RootDirectory= or the host. See: os-release(5).
每个 sysext 目录必须包含一个 /usr/lib/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE 文件，而每个 confext 目录必须携带一个 /etc/extension-release.d/extension-release.IMAGE 文件，其中包含与 RootImage= / RootDirectory= 或主机匹配的适当元数据。参见：os-release(5)。

Note that usage from user units requires overlayfs support in unprivileged user namespaces, which was first introduced in kernel v5.11.
请注意，从用户单元使用需要在非特权用户命名空间中支持 overlayfs，这是在内核 v5.11 中首次引入的。

This option is only available for system services, or for services running in per-user instances of the service manager in which case PrivateUsers= is implicitly enabled (requires unprivileged user namespaces support to be enabled in the kernel via the "kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=" sysctl).
此选项仅适用于系统服务，或者在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务，此时 PrivateUsers= 会被隐式启用（需要通过" kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone= "sysctl 在内核中启用非特权用户命名空间支持）。

Added in version 251. 添加在版本 251 中。

User/Group Identity¶ 用户/组身份 ¶

These options are only available for system services and are not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
这些选项仅适用于系统服务，不支持在以用户为实例运行的服务中使用。

User=, Group=¶  User= ， Group= ¶

Set the UNIX user or group that the processes are executed as, respectively. Takes a single user or group name, or a numeric ID as argument. For system services (services run by the system service manager, i.e. managed by PID 1) and for user services of the root user (services managed by root's instance of systemd --user), the default is "root", but User= may be used to specify a different user. For user services of any other user, switching user identity is not permitted, hence the only valid setting is the same user the user's service manager is running as. If no group is set, the default group of the user is used. This setting does not affect commands whose command line is prefixed with "+".
分别设置进程执行的 UNIX 用户或组。接受单个用户或组名称，或数字 ID 作为参数。对于系统服务（由系统服务管理器运行的服务，即由 PID 1 管理的服务）和根用户的用户服务（由 root 的 systemd --user 实例管理的服务），默认值为" root "，但可以使用 User= 指定不同的用户。对于任何其他用户的用户服务，不允许切换用户身份，因此唯一有效的设置是与用户的服务管理器相同的用户。如果未设置组，则使用用户的默认组。此设置不影响其命令行以" + "为前缀的命令。

Note that this enforces only weak restrictions on the user/group name syntax, but will generate warnings in many cases where user/group names do not adhere to the following rules: the specified name should consist only of the characters a-z, A-Z, 0-9, "_" and "-", except for the first character which must be one of a-z, A-Z and "_" (i.e. digits and "-" are not permitted as first character). The user/group name must have at least one character, and at most 31. These restrictions are made in order to avoid ambiguities and to ensure user/group names and unit files remain portable among Linux systems. For further details on the names accepted and the names warned about see User/Group Name Syntax.
请注意，这仅对用户/组名称语法施加了弱限制，但在许多情况下会生成警告，即用户/组名称不符合以下规则：指定的名称应仅由字符 a-z，A-Z，0-9，“ _ ”和“ - ”组成，除了第一个字符必须是 a-z，A-Z 和“ _ ”之一（即不允许使用数字和“ - ”作为第一个字符）。用户/组名称必须至少有一个字符，最多 31 个字符。这些限制是为了避免歧义，并确保用户/组名称和单元文件在 Linux 系统中保持可移植性。有关接受的名称和警告的名称的更多详细信息，请参阅用户/组名称语法。

When used in conjunction with DynamicUser= the user/group name specified is dynamically allocated at the time the service is started, and released at the time the service is stopped — unless it is already allocated statically (see below). If DynamicUser= is not used the specified user and group must have been created statically in the user database no later than the moment the service is started, for example using the sysusers.d(5) facility, which is applied at boot or package install time. If the user does not exist by then program invocation will fail.
当与 DynamicUser= 一起使用时，指定的用户/组名称在服务启动时动态分配，并在服务停止时释放 —— 除非它已经静态分配（请参见下文）。如果不使用 DynamicUser= ，则指定的用户和组必须在服务启动时在用户数据库中静态创建，例如使用在引导或软件包安装时应用的 sysusers.d(5)工具。如果用户在那时不存在，则程序调用将失败。

If the User= setting is used the supplementary group list is initialized from the specified user's default group list, as defined in the system's user and group database. Additional groups may be configured through the SupplementaryGroups= setting (see below).
如果使用 User= 设置，则从指定用户的默认组列表初始化附加组列表，如系统的用户和组数据库中定义的那样。可以通过 SupplementaryGroups= 设置配置其他组（请参见下文）。

DynamicUser=¶

Takes a boolean parameter. If set, a UNIX user and group pair is allocated dynamically when the unit is started, and released as soon as it is stopped. The user and group will not be added to /etc/passwd or /etc/group, but are managed transiently during runtime. The nss-systemd(8) glibc NSS module provides integration of these dynamic users/groups into the system's user and group databases. The user and group name to use may be configured via User= and Group= (see above). If these options are not used and dynamic user/group allocation is enabled for a unit, the name of the dynamic user/group is implicitly derived from the unit name. If the unit name without the type suffix qualifies as valid user name it is used directly, otherwise a name incorporating a hash of it is used. If a statically allocated user or group of the configured name already exists, it is used and no dynamic user/group is allocated. Note that if User= is specified and the static group with the name exists, then it is required that the static user with the name already exists. Similarly, if Group= is specified and the static user with the name exists, then it is required that the static group with the name already exists. Dynamic users/groups are allocated from the UID/GID range 61184…65519. It is recommended to avoid this range for regular system or login users. At any point in time each UID/GID from this range is only assigned to zero or one dynamically allocated users/groups in use. However, UID/GIDs are recycled after a unit is terminated. Care should be taken that any processes running as part of a unit for which dynamic users/groups are enabled do not leave files or directories owned by these users/groups around, as a different unit might get the same UID/GID assigned later on, and thus gain access to these files or directories. If DynamicUser= is enabled, RemoveIPC= and PrivateTmp= are implied (and cannot be turned off). This ensures that the lifetime of IPC objects and temporary files created by the executed processes is bound to the runtime of the service, and hence the lifetime of the dynamic user/group. Since /tmp/ and /var/tmp/ are usually the only world-writable directories on a system this ensures that a unit making use of dynamic user/group allocation cannot leave files around after unit termination. Furthermore NoNewPrivileges= and RestrictSUIDSGID= are implicitly enabled (and cannot be disabled), to ensure that processes invoked cannot take benefit or create SUID/SGID files or directories. Moreover ProtectSystem=strict and ProtectHome=read-only are implied, thus prohibiting the service to write to arbitrary file system locations. In order to allow the service to write to certain directories, they have to be allow-listed using ReadWritePaths=, but care must be taken so that UID/GID recycling doesn't create security issues involving files created by the service. Use RuntimeDirectory= (see below) in order to assign a writable runtime directory to a service, owned by the dynamic user/group and removed automatically when the unit is terminated. Use StateDirectory=, CacheDirectory= and LogsDirectory= in order to assign a set of writable directories for specific purposes to the service in a way that they are protected from vulnerabilities due to UID reuse (see below). If this option is enabled, care should be taken that the unit's processes do not get access to directories outside of these explicitly configured and managed ones. Specifically, do not use BindPaths= and be careful with AF_UNIX file descriptor passing for directory file descriptors, as this would permit processes to create files or directories owned by the dynamic user/group that are not subject to the lifecycle and access guarantees of the service. Note that this option is currently incompatible with D-Bus policies, thus a service using this option may currently not allocate a D-Bus service name (note that this does not affect calling into other D-Bus services). Defaults to off.
接受一个布尔参数。如果设置，当单元启动时动态分配 UNIX 用户和组对，并在停止时立即释放。用户和组不会添加到 /etc/passwd 或 /etc/group ，而是在运行时进行瞬时管理。nss-systemd(8) glibc NSS 模块将这些动态用户/组集成到系统的用户和组数据库中。可通过 User= 和 Group= 配置要使用的用户和组名称（请参见上文）。如果未使用这些选项并且为单元启用了动态用户/组分配，则动态用户/组的名称将隐式从单元名称派生。如果不带类型后缀的单元名称符合有效用户名的条件，则直接使用，否则使用包含其哈希的名称。如果已经存在具有配置名称的静态分配用户或组，则使用它，不会分配动态用户/组。请注意，如果指定了 User= 并且具有该名称的静态组存在，则需要已经存在具有该名称的静态用户。类似地，如果指定了 Group= 并且具有该名称的静态用户存在，则需要已经存在具有该名称的静态组。 动态用户/组从 UID/GID 范围 61184…65519 中分配。建议避免将此范围用于常规系统或登录用户。在任何时候，此范围内的每个 UID/GID 仅分配给零个或一个正在使用的动态分配用户/组。但是，在单元终止后，UID/GID 会被回收利用。应注意，任何作为启用动态用户/组的单元的一部分运行的进程不要留下由这些用户/组拥有的文件或目录，因为稍后可能会将相同的 UID/GID 分配给不同的单元，从而访问这些文件或目录。如果启用 DynamicUser= ，则隐含 RemoveIPC= 和 PrivateTmp= （无法关闭）。这确保了由执行的进程创建的 IPC 对象和临时文件的生命周期绑定到服务的运行时间，因此绑定到动态用户/组的生命周期。由于 /tmp/ 和 /var/tmp/ 通常是系统上唯一可由所有用户写入的目录，这确保了使用动态用户/组分配的单元在单元终止后不会留下文件。 此外， NoNewPrivileges= 和 RestrictSUIDSGID= 被隐式启用（无法禁用），以确保调用的进程无法受益或创建 SUID/SGID 文件或目录。此外， ProtectSystem=strict 和 ProtectHome=read-only 被隐含，因此禁止服务写入任意文件系统位置。为了允许服务写入某些目录，它们必须使用 ReadWritePaths= 进行白名单处理，但必须注意，以免 UID/GID 回收导致由服务创建的文件涉及安全问题。使用 RuntimeDirectory= （见下文）为服务分配一个可写的运行时目录，由动态用户/组拥有，并在单元终止时自动删除。使用 StateDirectory= 、 CacheDirectory= 和 LogsDirectory= 为服务分配一组可写目录，以特定目的保护它们免受由于 UID 重用而导致的漏洞（见下文）。如果启用了此选项，必须注意确保单元的进程无法访问这些明确配置和管理的目录之外的目录。 具体来说，不要使用 BindPaths= ，并小心使用 AF_UNIX 文件描述符传递目录文件描述符，因为这将允许进程创建由动态用户/组拥有的不受服务生命周期和访问保证约束的文件或目录。请注意，此选项目前与 D-Bus 策略不兼容，因此使用此选项的服务目前可能无法分配 D-Bus 服务名称（请注意，这不会影响调用其他 D-Bus 服务）。默认为关闭。

Added in version 232. 在版本 232 中添加。

SupplementaryGroups=¶

Sets the supplementary Unix groups the processes are executed as. This takes a space-separated list of group names or IDs. This option may be specified more than once, in which case all listed groups are set as supplementary groups. When the empty string is assigned, the list of supplementary groups is reset, and all assignments prior to this one will have no effect. In any way, this option does not override, but extends the list of supplementary groups configured in the system group database for the user. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
设置进程执行的附加 Unix 组。这需要一个以空格分隔的组名称或 ID 列表。此选项可以指定多次，这样所有列出的组都将设置为附加组。当分配空字符串时，附加组列表将被重置，并且在此之前的所有分配将不起作用。无论如何，此选项不会覆盖，而是扩展了为用户配置的系统组数据库中的附加组列表。这不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。

SetLoginEnvironment=¶

Takes a boolean parameter that controls whether to set $HOME, $LOGNAME, and $SHELL environment variables. If unset, this is controlled by whether User= is set. If true, they will always be set for system services, i.e. even when the default user "root" is used. If false, the mentioned variables are not set by systemd, no matter whether User= is used or not. This option normally has no effect on user services, since these variables are typically inherited from user manager's own environment anyway.
接受一个布尔参数，用于控制是否设置 $HOME 、 $LOGNAME 和 $SHELL 环境变量。如果未设置，这取决于是否设置了 User= 。如果为 true，则系统服务始终会设置这些变量，即使使用默认用户 " root "。如果为 false，则这些变量不会被 systemd 设置，无论是否使用 User= 。这个选项通常不会影响用户服务，因为这些变量通常会从用户管理器自己的环境中继承。

Added in version 255. 在版本 255 中添加。

PAMName=¶

Sets the PAM service name to set up a session as. If set, the executed process will be registered as a PAM session under the specified service name. This is only useful in conjunction with the User= setting, and is otherwise ignored. If not set, no PAM session will be opened for the executed processes. See pam(8) for details.
设置要建立会话的 PAM 服务名称。如果设置，执行的进程将在指定的服务名称下注册为 PAM 会话。这仅在与 User= 设置一起使用时有用，否则将被忽略。如果未设置，执行的进程将不会打开 PAM 会话。有关详细信息，请参阅 pam(8)。

Note that for each unit making use of this option a PAM session handler process will be maintained as part of the unit and stays around as long as the unit is active, to ensure that appropriate actions can be taken when the unit and hence the PAM session terminates. This process is named "(sd-pam)" and is an immediate child process of the unit's main process.
请注意，对于使用此选项的每个单元，将维护一个 PAM 会话处理程序作为该单元的一部分，并在单元处于活动状态时保持存在，以确保在单元和因此 PAM 会话终止时可以采取适当的操作。此进程被命名为 " (sd-pam) "，是单元主进程的直接子进程。

Note that when this option is used for a unit it is very likely (depending on PAM configuration) that the main unit process will be migrated to its own session scope unit when it is activated. This process will hence be associated with two units: the unit it was originally started from (and for which PAMName= was configured), and the session scope unit. Any child processes of that process will however be associated with the session scope unit only. This has implications when used in combination with NotifyAccess=all, as these child processes will not be able to affect changes in the original unit through notification messages. These messages will be considered belonging to the session scope unit and not the original unit. It is hence not recommended to use PAMName= in combination with NotifyAccess=all.
请注意，当为单元使用此选项时，很可能（取决于 PAM 配置）主单元进程在激活时将迁移到其自己的会话范围单元。因此，此进程将与两个单元相关联：它最初启动的单元（为其配置了 PAMName= ）和会话范围单元。但是，该进程的任何子进程将仅与会话范围单元相关联。当与 NotifyAccess= all 结合使用时，这将产生影响，因为这些子进程将无法通过通知消息影响原始单元的更改。这些消息将被视为属于会话范围单元，而不是原始单元。因此，不建议将 PAMName= 与 NotifyAccess= all 结合使用。

Capabilities¶ 功能权限

These options are only available for system services, or for services running in per-user instances of the service manager in which case PrivateUsers= is implicitly enabled (requires unprivileged user namespaces support to be enabled in the kernel via the "kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone=" sysctl).
这些选项仅适用于系统服务，或者在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务，此时 PrivateUsers= 会被隐式启用（需要在内核中通过 " kernel.unprivileged_userns_clone= " sysctl 启用非特权用户命名空间支持）。

CapabilityBoundingSet=¶

Controls which capabilities to include in the capability bounding set for the executed process. See capabilities(7) for details. Takes a whitespace-separated list of capability names, e.g. CAP_SYS_ADMIN, CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE, CAP_SYS_PTRACE. Capabilities listed will be included in the bounding set, all others are removed. If the list of capabilities is prefixed with "~", all but the listed capabilities will be included, the effect of the assignment inverted. Note that this option also affects the respective capabilities in the effective, permitted and inheritable capability sets. If this option is not used, the capability bounding set is not modified on process execution, hence no limits on the capabilities of the process are enforced. This option may appear more than once, in which case the bounding sets are merged by OR, or by AND if the lines are prefixed with "~" (see below). If the empty string is assigned to this option, the bounding set is reset to the empty capability set, and all prior settings have no effect. If set to "~" (without any further argument), the bounding set is reset to the full set of available capabilities, also undoing any previous settings. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
控制要在执行过程的能力边界集中包含哪些能力。有关详细信息，请参阅 capabilities(7)。接受以空格分隔的能力名称列表，例如 CAP_SYS_ADMIN ， CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE ， CAP_SYS_PTRACE 。列出的能力将包含在边界集中，所有其他能力将被移除。如果能力列表以“ ~ ”为前缀，则除了列出的能力之外，其他所有能力都将被包含，分配的效果将被反转。请注意，此选项还会影响有效、允许和可继承的能力集中的相应能力。如果不使用此选项，则在进程执行时不会修改能力边界集，因此不会强制执行对进程能力的任何限制。此选项可能会出现多次，此时通过 OR 合并边界集，或者如果行以“ ~ ”为前缀，则通过 AND 合并（请参见下文）。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则边界集将重置为空能力集，并且所有先前的设置将不起作用。如果设置为“ ~ ”（没有进一步的参数），则边界集将重置为所有可用能力的完整集，也会撤消任何先前的设置。 这不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。

Use systemd-analyze(1)'s capability command to retrieve a list of capabilities defined on the local system.
使用 systemd-analyze(1)的 capability 命令来检索本地系统上定义的功能列表。

Example: if a unit has the following,
例如：如果一个单元具有以下内容，

CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_A CAP_B
CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_B CAP_C

then CAP_A, CAP_B, and CAP_C are set. If the second line is prefixed with "~", e.g.,
如果设置了 CAP_A 、 CAP_B 和 CAP_C ，则第二行将被设置。如果第二行以 " ~ " 为前缀，例如，

CapabilityBoundingSet=CAP_A CAP_B
CapabilityBoundingSet=~CAP_B CAP_C

then, only CAP_A is set.
则只设置 CAP_A 。

AmbientCapabilities=¶

Controls which capabilities to include in the ambient capability set for the executed process. Takes a whitespace-separated list of capability names, e.g. CAP_SYS_ADMIN, CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE, CAP_SYS_PTRACE. This option may appear more than once, in which case the ambient capability sets are merged (see the above examples in CapabilityBoundingSet=). If the list of capabilities is prefixed with "~", all but the listed capabilities will be included, the effect of the assignment inverted. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the ambient capability set is reset to the empty capability set, and all prior settings have no effect. If set to "~" (without any further argument), the ambient capability set is reset to the full set of available capabilities, also undoing any previous settings. Note that adding capabilities to the ambient capability set adds them to the process's inherited capability set.
控制在执行过程中包含哪些能力到环境能力集中。接受一个以空格分隔的能力名称列表，例如 CAP_SYS_ADMIN 、 CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE 、 CAP_SYS_PTRACE 。此选项可以出现多次，此时环境能力集将被合并（请参见上述示例中的 CapabilityBoundingSet= ）。如果能力列表以 " ~ " 为前缀，则除列出的能力外，其他所有能力都将被包含，赋值的效果将被反转。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则环境能力集将被重置为空能力集，并且所有先前的设置将不起作用。如果设置为 " ~ "（没有进一步的参数），则环境能力集将被重置为所有可用能力的完整集合，也会撤消任何先前的设置。请注意，将能力添加到环境能力集会将它们添加到进程的继承能力集中。

Ambient capability sets are useful if you want to execute a process as a non-privileged user but still want to give it some capabilities. Note that in this case option keep-caps is automatically added to SecureBits= to retain the capabilities over the user change. AmbientCapabilities= does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
环境能力集在以下情况下很有用：如果您想以非特权用户身份执行进程，但仍希望赋予它一些能力。请注意，在这种情况下，选项 keep-caps 会自动添加到 SecureBits= 以保留用户更改后的能力。 AmbientCapabilities= 不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。

Added in version 229. 添加于版本 229。

Security¶ 安全 ¶

NoNewPrivileges=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If true, ensures that the service process and all its children can never gain new privileges through execve() (e.g. via setuid or setgid bits, or filesystem capabilities). This is the simplest and most effective way to ensure that a process and its children can never elevate privileges again. Defaults to false. In case the service will be run in a new mount namespace anyway and SELinux is disabled, all file systems are mounted with MS_NOSUID flag. Also see No New Privileges Flag.
接受一个布尔参数。如果为 true，则确保服务进程及其所有子进程永远不能通过 execve() （例如通过 setuid 或 setgid 位，或文件系统功能）获得新特权。这是确保进程及其子进程永远不能再次提升特权的最简单和最有效的方法。默认为 false。如果服务将在新的挂载命名空间中运行，且 SELinux 已禁用，则所有文件系统都将使用 MS_NOSUID 标志挂载。另请参阅无新特权标志。

Note that this setting only has an effect on the unit's processes themselves (or any processes directly or indirectly forked off them). It has no effect on processes potentially invoked on request of them through tools such as at(1), crontab(1), systemd-run(1), or arbitrary IPC services.
请注意，此设置仅对单元的进程本身（或直接或间接从它们派生的任何进程）产生影响。它不会对通过诸如 at(1)、crontab(1)、systemd-run(1)或任意 IPC 服务等工具可能被请求的进程产生影响。

Added in version 187. 自版本 187 中添加。

SecureBits=¶

Controls the secure bits set for the executed process. Takes a space-separated combination of options from the following list: keep-caps, keep-caps-locked, no-setuid-fixup, no-setuid-fixup-locked, noroot, and noroot-locked. This option may appear more than once, in which case the secure bits are ORed. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the bits are reset to 0. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+". See capabilities(7) for details.
控制执行进程设置的安全位。从以下列表中选择一个或多个选项，用空格分隔： keep-caps ， keep-caps-locked ， no-setuid-fixup ， no-setuid-fixup-locked ， noroot 和 noroot-locked 。如果多次出现此选项，则安全位进行逻辑 OR 运算。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则位将重置为 0。这不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。有关详细信息，请参阅 capabilities(7)。

Mandatory Access Control¶
强制访问控制

These options are only available for system services and are not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
这些选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

SELinuxContext=¶

Set the SELinux security context of the executed process. If set, this will override the automated domain transition. However, the policy still needs to authorize the transition. This directive is ignored if SELinux is disabled. If prefixed by "-", failing to set the SELinux security context will be ignored, but it's still possible that the subsequent execve() may fail if the policy doesn't allow the transition for the non-overridden context. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+". See setexeccon(3) for details.
设置执行进程的 SELinux 安全上下文。如果设置了，这将覆盖自动域转换。但是，策略仍然需要授权转换。如果 SELinux 已禁用，则忽略此指令。如果以“ - ”为前缀，则忽略未设置 SELinux 安全上下文，但如果策略不允许非覆盖上下文的转换，则后续的 execve() 可能会失败。这不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。有关详细信息，请参阅 setexeccon(3)。

Added in version 209. 在版本 209 中添加。

AppArmorProfile=¶

Takes a profile name as argument. The process executed by the unit will switch to this profile when started. Profiles must already be loaded in the kernel, or the unit will fail. If prefixed by "-", all errors will be ignored. This setting has no effect if AppArmor is not enabled. This setting does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
以配置文件名作为参数。单元执行的进程将在启动时切换到此配置文件。配置文件必须已加载到内核中，否则单元将失败。如果以“ - ”为前缀，则将忽略所有错误。如果未启用 AppArmor，则此设置不起作用。此设置不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。

Added in version 210. 添加于版本 210。

SmackProcessLabel=¶

Takes a SMACK64 security label as argument. The process executed by the unit will be started under this label and SMACK will decide whether the process is allowed to run or not, based on it. The process will continue to run under the label specified here unless the executable has its own SMACK64EXEC label, in which case the process will transition to run under that label. When not specified, the label that systemd is running under is used. This directive is ignored if SMACK is disabled.
接受一个 SMACK64 安全标签作为参数。由该单元执行的进程将在此标签下启动，并由 SMACK 决定该进程是否被允许运行，基于此标签。该进程将继续在此处指定的标签下运行，除非可执行文件具有自己的 SMACK64EXEC 标签，在这种情况下，进程将转换为在该标签下运行。如果未指定，则使用 systemd 正在运行的标签。如果 SMACK 被禁用，则忽略此指令。

The value may be prefixed by "-", in which case all errors will be ignored. An empty value may be specified to unset previous assignments. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
该值可以以“ - ”为前缀，此时将忽略所有错误。可以指定空值以取消先前的赋值。这不会影响以“ + ”为前缀的命令。

Added in version 218. 在版本 218 中添加。

Process Properties¶ 处理属性 ¶

LimitCPU=, LimitFSIZE=, LimitDATA=, LimitSTACK=, LimitCORE=, LimitRSS=, LimitNOFILE=, LimitAS=, LimitNPROC=, LimitMEMLOCK=, LimitLOCKS=, LimitSIGPENDING=, LimitMSGQUEUE=, LimitNICE=, LimitRTPRIO=, LimitRTTIME=¶
LimitCPU= ， LimitFSIZE= ， LimitDATA= ， LimitSTACK= ， LimitCORE= ， LimitRSS= ， LimitNOFILE= ， LimitAS= ， LimitNPROC= ， LimitMEMLOCK= ， LimitLOCKS= ， LimitSIGPENDING= ， LimitMSGQUEUE= ， LimitNICE= ， LimitRTPRIO= ， LimitRTTIME= ¶

Set soft and hard limits on various resources for executed processes. See setrlimit(2) for details on the process resource limit concept. Process resource limits may be specified in two formats: either as single value to set a specific soft and hard limit to the same value, or as colon-separated pair soft:hard to set both limits individually (e.g. "LimitAS=4G:16G"). Use the string infinity to configure no limit on a specific resource. The multiplicative suffixes K, M, G, T, P and E (to the base 1024) may be used for resource limits measured in bytes (e.g. "LimitAS=16G"). For the limits referring to time values, the usual time units ms, s, min, h and so on may be used (see systemd.time(7) for details). Note that if no time unit is specified for LimitCPU= the default unit of seconds is implied, while for LimitRTTIME= the default unit of microseconds is implied. Also, note that the effective granularity of the limits might influence their enforcement. For example, time limits specified for LimitCPU= will be rounded up implicitly to multiples of 1s. For LimitNICE= the value may be specified in two syntaxes: if prefixed with "+" or "-", the value is understood as regular Linux nice value in the range -20…19. If not prefixed like this the value is understood as raw resource limit parameter in the range 0…40 (with 0 being equivalent to 1).
在执行的进程上设置各种资源的软限制和硬限制。有关进程资源限制概念的详细信息，请参阅 setrlimit(2)。进程资源限制可以以两种格式指定：一种是将单个值设置为特定软限制和硬限制的相同值，另一种是以冒号分隔的一对 soft:hard 来分别设置两个限制（例如“ LimitAS=4G:16G ”）。使用字符串 infinity 来配置特定资源的无限制。可以使用乘法后缀 K、M、G、T、P 和 E（以 1024 为基数）来表示以字节为单位的资源限制（例如“ LimitAS=16G ”）。对于与时间值有关的限制，可以使用常见的时间单位 ms、s、min、h 等（有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.time(7)）。请注意，如果未为 LimitCPU= 指定时间单位，则默认的单位为秒，而对于 LimitRTTIME= ，默认的单位为微秒。还要注意，限制的有效粒度可能会影响其执行。例如，为 LimitCPU= 指定的时间限制将隐式地四舍五入为 1 秒的倍数。对于 LimitNICE= ，值可以以两种语法指定：如果以“ + ”或“ - ”为前缀，则该值将被理解为范围在-20 至 19 之间的常规 Linux 优先级值。 如果不像这样前缀，该值将被理解为在范围 0…40 内的原始资源限制参数（其中 0 相当于 1）。

Note that most process resource limits configured with these options are per-process, and processes may fork in order to acquire a new set of resources that are accounted independently of the original process, and may thus escape limits set. Also note that LimitRSS= is not implemented on Linux, and setting it has no effect. Often it is advisable to prefer the resource controls listed in systemd.resource-control(5) over these per-process limits, as they apply to services as a whole, may be altered dynamically at runtime, and are generally more expressive. For example, MemoryMax= is a more powerful (and working) replacement for LimitRSS=.
请注意，使用这些选项配置的大多数进程资源限制是针对每个进程的，并且进程可能会分叉以获取一组新的资源，这些资源独立计算，因此可能会超出设置的限制。还请注意，Linux 上未实现 LimitRSS= ，设置它没有任何效果。通常建议优先使用 systemd.resource-control(5) 中列出的资源控制，而不是这些针对每个进程的限制，因为它们适用于整个服务，可以在运行时动态更改，并且通常更具表现力。例如， MemoryMax= 是 LimitRSS= 的更强大（且有效）替代品。

Note that LimitNPROC= will limit the number of processes from one (real) UID and not the number of processes started (forked) by the service. Therefore the limit is cumulative for all processes running under the same UID. Please also note that the LimitNPROC= will not be enforced if the service is running as root (and not dropping privileges). Due to these limitations, TasksMax= (see systemd.resource-control(5)) is typically a better choice than LimitNPROC=.
请注意， LimitNPROC= 会限制一个（真实的）UID 下的进程数量，而不是服务启动（分叉）的进程数量。因此，对于所有在相同 UID 下运行的进程，限制是累积的。还请注意，如果服务以 root 用户身份运行（而不是放弃权限）， LimitNPROC= 将不会被执行。由于这些限制，通常情况下， TasksMax= （请参阅 systemd.resource-control(5)）比 LimitNPROC= 更好。

Resource limits not configured explicitly for a unit default to the value configured in the various DefaultLimitCPU=, DefaultLimitFSIZE=, … options available in systemd-system.conf(5), and – if not configured there – the kernel or per-user defaults, as defined by the OS (the latter only for user services, see below).
未为单元明确配置资源限制时，默认值为 systemd-system.conf(5) 中可用的各种选项中配置的值，以及内核或操作系统定义的每个用户默认值（仅适用于用户服务，请参见下文）。

For system units these resource limits may be chosen freely. When these settings are configured in a user service (i.e. a service run by the per-user instance of the service manager) they cannot be used to raise the limits above those set for the user manager itself when it was first invoked, as the user's service manager generally lacks the privileges to do so. In user context these configuration options are hence only useful to lower the limits passed in or to raise the soft limit to the maximum of the hard limit as configured for the user. To raise the user's limits further, the available configuration mechanisms differ between operating systems, but typically require privileges. In most cases it is possible to configure higher per-user resource limits via PAM or by setting limits on the system service encapsulating the user's service manager, i.e. the user's instance of user@.service. After making such changes, make sure to restart the user's service manager.
对于系统单元，这些资源限制可以自由选择。当这些设置配置在用户服务中（即由服务管理器的每个用户实例运行的服务），它们不能用于将限制提高到首次调用用户管理器时设置的限制以上，因为用户的服务管理器通常缺乏执行此操作的特权。在用户环境中，这些配置选项因此只有在降低传递的限制或将软限制提高到为用户配置的硬限制的最大值时才有用。要进一步提高用户的限制，可用的配置机制在操作系统之间有所不同，但通常需要特权。在大多数情况下，可以通过 PAM 或通过设置封装用户服务管理器的系统服务上的限制来配置更高的每用户资源限制，即用户的 user@.service 实例。进行此类更改后，请确保重新启动用户的服务管理器。

Table 1. Resource limit directives, their equivalent ulimit shell commands and the unit used
表 1。资源限制指令，它们等效的 ulimit shell 命令和使用的单位

Directiveulimit equivalent ulimit 等效UnitNotes
LimitCPU= 限制 CPU=ulimit -tSeconds-
LimitFSIZE= 限制 FSIZE=ulimit -fBytes-
LimitDATA=ulimit -dBytesDon't use. This limits the allowed address range, not memory use! Defaults to unlimited and should not be lowered. To limit memory use, see MemoryMax= in systemd.resource-control(5).
不要使用。这会限制允许的地址范围，而不是内存使用！默认为无限制，不应降低。要限制内存使用，请参见 systemd.resource-control(5)中的 MemoryMax= 。
LimitSTACK=ulimit -sBytes-
LimitCORE= 限制 CORE=ulimit -cBytes-
LimitRSS= 限制 RSS=ulimit -mBytesDon't use. No effect on Linux.
不要使用。在 Linux 上没有影响。
LimitNOFILE=ulimit -nNumber of File Descriptors
文件描述符数量		Don't use. Be careful when raising the soft limit above 1024, since select(2) cannot function with file descriptors above 1023 on Linux. Nowadays, the hard limit defaults to 524288, a very high value compared to historical defaults. Typically applications should increase their soft limit to the hard limit on their own, if they are OK with working with file descriptors above 1023, i.e. do not use select(2). Note that file descriptors are nowadays accounted like any other form of memory, thus there should not be any need to lower the hard limit. Use MemoryMax= to control overall service memory use, including file descriptor memory.
不要使用。在将软限制提高到 1024 以上时要小心，因为 Linux 上的 select(2)无法处理超过 1023 的文件描述符。如今，硬限制默认为 524288，与历史默认值相比非常高。通常应用程序应该将其软限制增加到硬限制，如果它们可以使用超过 1023 的文件描述符，即不使用 select(2)。请注意，文件描述符现在像任何其他形式的内存一样计算，因此不应该降低硬限制。使用 MemoryMax= 来控制整体服务内存使用，包括文件描述符内存。
LimitAS= 限制 AS=ulimit -vBytesDon't use. This limits the allowed address range, not memory use! Defaults to unlimited and should not be lowered. To limit memory use, see MemoryMax= in systemd.resource-control(5).
不要使用。这会限制允许的地址范围，而不是内存使用！默认为无限制，不应降低。要限制内存使用，请参见 systemd.resource-control(5)中的 MemoryMax= 。
LimitNPROC= 限制 NPROC=ulimit -uNumber of Processes 进程数量This limit is enforced based on the number of processes belonging to the user. Typically it's better to track processes per service, i.e. use TasksMax=, see systemd.resource-control(5).
此限制是基于属于用户的进程数量来执行的。通常最好跟踪每个服务的进程，即使用 TasksMax= ，请参阅 systemd.resource-control(5)。
LimitMEMLOCK=ulimit -lBytes-
LimitLOCKS= 限制 LOCKS=ulimit -xNumber of Locks 锁定数量-
LimitSIGPENDING= 限制 SIGPENDING=ulimit -iNumber of Queued Signals 排队信号数-
LimitMSGQUEUE= 限制 MSGQUEUE=ulimit -qBytes-
LimitNICE= 限制 NICE=ulimit -eNice Level 优先级-
LimitRTPRIO=ulimit -rRealtime Priority 实时优先级-
LimitRTTIME=ulimit -RMicroseconds-

UMask=¶

Controls the file mode creation mask. Takes an access mode in octal notation. See umask(2) for details. Defaults to 0022 for system units. For user units the default value is inherited from the per-user service manager (whose default is in turn inherited from the system service manager, and thus typically also is 0022 — unless overridden by a PAM module). In order to change the per-user mask for all user services, consider setting the UMask= setting of the user's user@.service system service instance. The per-user umask may also be set via the umask field of a user's JSON User Record (for users managed by systemd-homed.service(8) this field may be controlled via homectl --umask=). It may also be set via a PAM module, such as pam_umask(8).
控制文件模式创建掩码。以八进制表示的访问模式。有关详细信息，请参阅 umask(2)。对于系统单元，默认值为 0022。对于用户单元，默认值继承自每个用户服务管理器（其默认值又继承自系统服务管理器，因此通常也是 0022 — 除非被 PAM 模块覆盖）。为了更改所有用户服务的每个用户掩码，请考虑设置用户的每个用户系统服务实例的 UMask= 设置。每个用户的 umask 也可以通过用户的 JSON 用户记录的 umask 字段设置（对于由 systemd-homed.service(8)管理的用户，此字段可以通过 homectl --umask=控制）。也可以通过 PAM 模块（例如 pam_umask(8)）设置。

CoredumpFilter=¶

Controls which types of memory mappings will be saved if the process dumps core (using the /proc/pid/coredump_filter file). Takes a whitespace-separated combination of mapping type names or numbers (with the default base 16). Mapping type names are private-anonymous, shared-anonymous, private-file-backed, shared-file-backed, elf-headers, private-huge, shared-huge, private-dax, shared-dax, and the special values all (all types) and default (the kernel default of "private-anonymous shared-anonymous elf-headers private-huge"). See core(5) for the meaning of the mapping types. When specified multiple times, all specified masks are ORed. When not set, or if the empty value is assigned, the inherited value is not changed.
控制哪些类型的内存映射将在进程转储核心时保存（使用 /proc/pid/coredump_filter 文件）。接受映射类型名称或数字的空格分隔组合（默认为基数 16）。映射类型名称为 private-anonymous ， shared-anonymous ， private-file-backed ， shared-file-backed ， elf-headers ， private-huge ， shared-huge ， private-dax ， shared-dax 和特殊值 all （所有类型）和 default （内核默认为" private-anonymous shared-anonymous elf-headers private-huge "）。请参阅 core(5)以了解映射类型的含义。当指定多次时，所有指定的掩码都进行 OR 运算。如果未设置，或者分配了空值，则继承的值不会更改。

Example 2. Add DAX pages to the dump filter
示例 2. 将 DAX 页面添加到转储过滤器

CoredumpFilter=default private-dax shared-dax

Added in version 246. 添加于版本 246。

KeyringMode=¶

Controls how the kernel session keyring is set up for the service (see session-keyring(7) for details on the session keyring). Takes one of inherit, private, shared. If set to inherit no special keyring setup is done, and the kernel's default behaviour is applied. If private is used a new session keyring is allocated when a service process is invoked, and it is not linked up with any user keyring. This is the recommended setting for system services, as this ensures that multiple services running under the same system user ID (in particular the root user) do not share their key material among each other. If shared is used a new session keyring is allocated as for private, but the user keyring of the user configured with User= is linked into it, so that keys assigned to the user may be requested by the unit's processes. In this mode multiple units running processes under the same user ID may share key material. Unless inherit is selected the unique invocation ID for the unit (see below) is added as a protected key by the name "invocation_id" to the newly created session keyring. Defaults to private for services of the system service manager and to inherit for non-service units and for services of the user service manager.
控制内核会话密钥环为服务设置的方式（有关会话密钥环的详细信息，请参阅 session-keyring(7)）。取值为 inherit ， private ， shared 中的一个。如果设置为 inherit ，则不会进行特殊的密钥环设置，而会应用内核的默认行为。如果使用 private ，则在调用服务进程时会分配一个新的会话密钥环，并且不会与任何用户密钥环关联。这是系统服务的推荐设置，因为这样可以确保在相同系统用户 ID（特别是 root 用户）下运行的多个服务不会共享彼此的密钥材料。如果使用 shared ，则会分配一个新的会话密钥环，就像 private 一样，但会将配置为 User= 的用户密钥环链接到其中，以便单元的进程可以请求分配给用户的密钥。在此模式下，以相同用户 ID 运行进程的多个单元可以共享密钥材料。除非选择 inherit ，否则将单元的唯一调用 ID（请参见下文）作为名称为" invocation_id "的受保护密钥添加到新创建的会话密钥环中。 对于系统服务管理器的服务，默认为 private ，对于非服务单元和用户服务管理器的服务，默认为 inherit 。

Added in version 235. 在版本 235 中添加。

OOMScoreAdjust=¶

Sets the adjustment value for the Linux kernel's Out-Of-Memory (OOM) killer score for executed processes. Takes an integer between -1000 (to disable OOM killing of processes of this unit) and 1000 (to make killing of processes of this unit under memory pressure very likely). See The /proc Filesystem for details. If not specified defaults to the OOM score adjustment level of the service manager itself, which is normally at 0.
设置执行进程的 Linux 内核内存溢出（OOM）杀手分数的调整值。取值范围为-1000（禁用此单元进程的 OOM 杀死）到 1000（使此单元进程在内存压力下被杀死的可能性很高）。有关详细信息，请参阅/proc 文件系统。如果未指定，默认为服务管理器本身的 OOM 分数调整级别，通常为 0。

Use the OOMPolicy= setting of service units to configure how the service manager shall react to the kernel OOM killer or systemd-oomd terminating a process of the service. See systemd.service(5) for details.
使用服务单元的 OOMPolicy= 设置来配置服务管理器对内核 OOM 杀手或 systemd-oomd 终止服务进程的反应。有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.service(5)。

TimerSlackNSec=¶

Sets the timer slack in nanoseconds for the executed processes. The timer slack controls the accuracy of wake-ups triggered by timers. See prctl(2) for more information. Note that in contrast to most other time span definitions this parameter takes an integer value in nano-seconds if no unit is specified. The usual time units are understood too.
设置执行进程的纳秒定时器松弛度。定时器松弛度控制定时器触发的唤醒的准确性。有关更多信息，请参阅 prctl(2)。请注意，与大多数其他时间跨度定义相反，如果未指定单位，则此参数将以纳秒为单位的整数值。通常也可以理解时间单位。

Personality=¶

Controls which kernel architecture uname(2) shall report, when invoked by unit processes. Takes one of the architecture identifiers arm64, arm64-be, arm, arm-be, x86, x86-64, ppc, ppc-le, ppc64, ppc64-le, s390 or s390x. Which personality architectures are supported depends on the kernel's native architecture. Usually the 64-bit versions of the various system architectures support their immediate 32-bit personality architecture counterpart, but no others. For example, x86-64 systems support the x86-64 and x86 personalities but no others. The personality feature is useful when running 32-bit services on a 64-bit host system. If not specified, the personality is left unmodified and thus reflects the personality of the host system's kernel. This option is not useful on architectures for which only one native word width was ever available, such as m68k (32-bit only) or alpha (64-bit only).
控制在由单元进程调用时，uname(2) 应报告哪个内核架构。取值为架构标识符 arm64 、 arm64-be 、 arm 、 arm-be 、 x86 、 x86-64 、 ppc 、 ppc-le 、 ppc64 、 ppc64-le 、 s390 或 s390x 中的一个。支持哪些人格架构取决于内核的本机架构。通常各种系统架构的 64 位版本支持其直接的 32 位人格架构对应项，但不支持其他架构。例如， x86-64 系统支持 x86-64 和 x86 人格，但不支持其他人格。在 64 位主机系统上运行 32 位服务时，人格特性非常有用。如果未指定，人格将保持不变，因此反映主机系统内核的人格。此选项对于仅有一个本机字宽可用的架构并不实用，例如 m68k （仅限 32 位）或 alpha （仅限 64 位）。

Added in version 209. 在版本 209 中添加。

IgnoreSIGPIPE=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If true, causes SIGPIPE to be ignored in the executed process. Defaults to true because SIGPIPE generally is useful only in shell pipelines.
接受布尔参数。如果为 true，则导致在执行的进程中忽略 SIGPIPE 。默认为 true，因为 SIGPIPE 通常仅在 shell 管道中有用。

Scheduling¶ 调度

Nice=¶

Sets the default nice level (scheduling priority) for executed processes. Takes an integer between -20 (highest priority) and 19 (lowest priority). In case of resource contention, smaller values mean more resources will be made available to the unit's processes, larger values mean less resources will be made available. See setpriority(2) for details.
设置执行进程的默认 nice 级别（调度优先级）。取值范围为-20（最高优先级）到 19（最低优先级）。在资源争用情况下，较小的值意味着更多的资源将被分配给单元的进程，较大的值意味着分配的资源更少。有关详细信息，请参阅 setpriority(2)。

CPUSchedulingPolicy=¶

Sets the CPU scheduling policy for executed processes. Takes one of other, batch, idle, fifo or rr. See sched_setscheduler(2) for details.
设置执行进程的 CPU 调度策略。可取值为 other 、 batch 、 idle 、 fifo 或 rr 。有关详细信息，请参阅 sched_setscheduler(2)。

CPUSchedulingPriority=¶

Sets the CPU scheduling priority for executed processes. The available priority range depends on the selected CPU scheduling policy (see above). For real-time scheduling policies an integer between 1 (lowest priority) and 99 (highest priority) can be used. In case of CPU resource contention, smaller values mean less CPU time is made available to the service, larger values mean more. See sched_setscheduler(2) for details.
设置执行进程的 CPU 调度优先级。可用的优先级范围取决于所选的 CPU 调度策略（参见上文）。对于实时调度策略，可使用 1（最低优先级）到 99（最高优先级）之间的整数。在 CPU 资源争用情况下，较小的值意味着为服务提供的 CPU 时间更少，较大的值意味着提供更多。有关详细信息，请参阅 sched_setscheduler(2)。

CPUSchedulingResetOnFork=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If true, elevated CPU scheduling priorities and policies will be reset when the executed processes call fork(2), and can hence not leak into child processes. See sched_setscheduler(2) for details. Defaults to false.
接受一个布尔参数。如果为 true，则在执行进程调用 fork(2)时将重置提升的 CPU 调度优先级和策略，因此不能泄漏到子进程中。有关详细信息，请参阅 sched_setscheduler(2)。默认为 false。

CPUAffinity=¶

Controls the CPU affinity of the executed processes. Takes a list of CPU indices or ranges separated by either whitespace or commas. Alternatively, takes a special "numa" value in which case systemd automatically derives allowed CPU range based on the value of NUMAMask= option. CPU ranges are specified by the lower and upper CPU indices separated by a dash. This option may be specified more than once, in which case the specified CPU affinity masks are merged. If the empty string is assigned, the mask is reset, all assignments prior to this will have no effect. See sched_setaffinity(2) for details.
控制执行进程的 CPU 亲和性。接受由空格或逗号分隔的 CPU 索引或范围列表。或者，采用特殊的“numa”值，此时 systemd 会根据 NUMAMask= 选项的值自动推导允许的 CPU 范围。CPU 范围由以破折号分隔的较低和较高 CPU 索引指定。此选项可以指定多次，此时指定的 CPU 亲和性掩码将被合并。如果分配空字符串，则重置掩码，之前的所有分配将不起作用。有关详细信息，请参阅 sched_setaffinity(2)。

NUMAPolicy=¶

Controls the NUMA memory policy of the executed processes. Takes a policy type, one of: default, preferred, bind, interleave and local. A list of NUMA nodes that should be associated with the policy must be specified in NUMAMask=. For more details on each policy please see, set_mempolicy(2). For overall overview of NUMA support in Linux see, numa(7).
控制执行进程的 NUMA 内存策略。接受策略类型，其中之一为: default , preferred , bind , interleave 和 local 。必须在 NUMAMask= 中指定应与策略关联的 NUMA 节点列表。有关每种策略的更多详细信息，请参阅 set_mempolicy(2)。有关 Linux 中 NUMA 支持的总体概述，请参阅 numa(7)。

Added in version 243.
自版本 243 中添加。

NUMAMask=¶

Controls the NUMA node list which will be applied alongside with selected NUMA policy. Takes a list of NUMA nodes and has the same syntax as a list of CPUs for CPUAffinity= option or special "all" value which will include all available NUMA nodes in the mask. Note that the list of NUMA nodes is not required for default and local policies and for preferred policy we expect a single NUMA node.
控制将与所选 NUMA 策略一起应用的 NUMA 节点列表。接受一个 NUMA 节点列表，并具有与 CPUAffinity= 选项的 CPU 列表相同的语法，或特殊的“all”值，该值将包括掩码中的所有可用 NUMA 节点。请注意，对于 default 和 local 策略，不需要 NUMA 节点列表，对于 preferred 策略，我们期望一个单独的 NUMA 节点。

Added in version 243. 添加在版本 243 中。

IOSchedulingClass=¶

Sets the I/O scheduling class for executed processes. Takes one of the strings realtime, best-effort or idle. The kernel's default scheduling class is best-effort at a priority of 4. If the empty string is assigned to this option, all prior assignments to both IOSchedulingClass= and IOSchedulingPriority= have no effect. See ioprio_set(2) for details.
设置执行进程的 I/O 调度类别。接受字符串 realtime 、 best-effort 或 idle 中的一个。内核的默认调度类别是 best-effort ，优先级为 4。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则对 IOSchedulingClass= 和 IOSchedulingPriority= 的所有先前分配均无效。有关详细信息，请参阅 ioprio_set(2)。

IOSchedulingPriority=¶

Sets the I/O scheduling priority for executed processes. Takes an integer between 0 (highest priority) and 7 (lowest priority). In case of I/O contention, smaller values mean more I/O bandwidth is made available to the unit's processes, larger values mean less bandwidth. The available priorities depend on the selected I/O scheduling class (see above). If the empty string is assigned to this option, all prior assignments to both IOSchedulingClass= and IOSchedulingPriority= have no effect. For the kernel's default scheduling class (best-effort) this defaults to 4. See ioprio_set(2) for details.
设置执行进程的 I/O 调度优先级。取值范围为 0（最高优先级）到 7（最低优先级）。在 I/O 争用的情况下，较小的值意味着为单元的进程提供更多的 I/O 带宽，较大的值意味着提供更少的带宽。可用的优先级取决于所选的 I/O 调度类（见上文）。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则对 IOSchedulingClass= 和 IOSchedulingPriority= 的所有先前分配均无效。对于内核的默认调度类（ best-effort ），默认值为 4。有关详细信息，请参阅 ioprio_set(2)。

Sandboxing¶ 沙盒化

The following sandboxing options are an effective way to limit the exposure of the system towards the unit's processes. It is recommended to turn on as many of these options for each unit as is possible without negatively affecting the process' ability to operate. Note that many of these sandboxing features are gracefully turned off on systems where the underlying security mechanism is not available. For example, ProtectSystem= has no effect if the kernel is built without file system namespacing or if the service manager runs in a container manager that makes file system namespacing unavailable to its payload. Similarly, RestrictRealtime= has no effect on systems that lack support for SECCOMP system call filtering, or in containers where support for this is turned off.
以下沙盒选项是限制系统暴露于单元进程的有效方法。建议尽可能为每个单元打开这些选项，而不会对进程的运行能力产生负面影响。请注意，许多这些沙盒功能会在底层安全机制不可用的系统上自动关闭。例如，如果内核没有构建文件系统命名空间，或者服务管理器在容器管理器中运行，使文件系统命名空间对其有效载荷不可用，则 ProtectSystem= 不起作用。同样，如果系统不支持 SECCOMP 系统调用过滤，或者在容器中关闭了对此的支持，则 RestrictRealtime= 不起作用。

Also note that some sandboxing functionality is generally not available in user services (i.e. services run by the per-user service manager). Specifically, the various settings requiring file system namespacing support (such as ProtectSystem=) are not available, as the underlying kernel functionality is only accessible to privileged processes. However, most namespacing settings, that will not work on their own in user services, will work when used in conjunction with PrivateUsers=true.
还要注意，一些沙盒功能通常在用户服务中不可用（即由每个用户服务管理器运行的服务）。具体来说，需要文件系统命名空间支持的各种设置（例如 ProtectSystem= ）不可用，因为底层内核功能仅对特权进程可访问。但是，大多数命名空间设置，在用户服务中单独使用时无法工作，但与 PrivateUsers= true 结合使用时将起作用。

ProtectSystem=¶

Takes a boolean argument or the special values "full" or "strict". If true, mounts the /usr/ and the boot loader directories (/boot and /efi) read-only for processes invoked by this unit. If set to "full", the /etc/ directory is mounted read-only, too. If set to "strict" the entire file system hierarchy is mounted read-only, except for the API file system subtrees /dev/, /proc/ and /sys/ (protect these directories using PrivateDevices=, ProtectKernelTunables=, ProtectControlGroups=). This setting ensures that any modification of the vendor-supplied operating system (and optionally its configuration, and local mounts) is prohibited for the service.
