Specifically these are the options PrivateTmp=, PrivateDevices=, ProtectSystem=, ProtectHome=, ProtectKernelTunables=, ProtectControlGroups=, ProtectKernelLogs=, ProtectClock=, ReadOnlyPaths=, InaccessiblePaths= and ReadWritePaths=.
建议将文件系统命名空间相关选项与 SystemCallFilter=~@mount 结合使用，以防止单元的进程撤消映射。具体来说，这些选项是 PrivateTmp= ， PrivateDevices= ， ProtectSystem= ， ProtectHome= ， ProtectKernelTunables= ， ProtectControlGroups= ， ProtectKernelLogs= ， ProtectClock= ， ReadOnlyPaths= ， InaccessiblePaths= 和 ReadWritePaths= 。

Added in version 187. 添加在版本 187 中。

SystemCallErrorNumber=¶

Takes an "errno" error number (between 1 and 4095) or errno name such as EPERM, EACCES or EUCLEAN, to return when the system call filter configured with SystemCallFilter= is triggered, instead of terminating the process immediately. See errno(3) for a full list of error codes. When this setting is not used, or when the empty string or the special setting "kill" is assigned, the process will be terminated immediately when the filter is triggered.
接受一个 " errno " 错误号（介于 1 和 4095 之间）或 errno 名称，如 EPERM ， EACCES 或 EUCLEAN ，当配置了 SystemCallFilter= 的系统调用过滤器触发时返回，而不是立即终止进程。请参阅 errno(3) 获取完整的错误代码列表。当未使用此设置，或者当分配空字符串或特殊设置 " kill " 时，进程将在触发过滤器时立即终止。

Added in version 209. 在版本 209 中添加。

SystemCallArchitectures=¶

Takes a space-separated list of architecture identifiers to include in the system call filter. The known architecture identifiers are the same as for ConditionArchitecture= described in systemd.unit(5), as well as x32, mips64-n32, mips64-le-n32, and the special identifier native. The special identifier native implicitly maps to the native architecture of the system (or more precisely: to the architecture the system manager is compiled for). By default, this option is set to the empty list, i.e. no filtering is applied.
接受一个以空格分隔的架构标识符列表，以包含在系统调用过滤器中。已知的架构标识符与 systemd.unit(5) 中描述的相同，以及 x32 、 mips64-n32 、 mips64-le-n32 ，以及特殊标识符 native 。特殊标识符 native 隐式映射到系统的本机架构（或更准确地说：系统管理器编译的架构）。默认情况下，此选项设置为空列表，即不应用过滤。

If this setting is used, processes of this unit will only be permitted to call native system calls, and system calls of the specified architectures. For the purposes of this option, the x32 architecture is treated as including x86-64 system calls. However, this setting still fulfills its purpose, as explained below, on x32.
如果使用此设置，此单元的进程将只被允许调用本机系统调用和指定架构的系统调用。对于此选项，x32 架构被视为包含 x86-64 系统调用。然而，在 x32 上，此设置仍然实现其目的，如下所解释。

System call filtering is not equally effective on all architectures. For example, on x86 filtering of network socket-related calls is not possible, due to ABI limitations — a limitation that x86-64 does not have, however. On systems supporting multiple ABIs at the same time — such as x86/x86-64 — it is hence recommended to limit the set of permitted system call architectures so that secondary ABIs may not be used to circumvent the restrictions applied to the native ABI of the system. In particular, setting SystemCallArchitectures=native is a good choice for disabling non-native ABIs.
系统调用过滤在所有架构上的效果并不相同。例如，在 x86 上，由于 ABI 限制，无法过滤与网络套接字相关的调用 — 这是 x86-64 没有的限制。然而，在同时支持多个 ABI 的系统上 — 例如 x86/x86-64 — 因此建议限制允许的系统调用架构集，以便次要 ABI 不能用于规避应用于系统本机 ABI 的限制。特别是，设置 SystemCallArchitectures=native 是禁用非本机 ABI 的一个很好的选择。

System call architectures may also be restricted system-wide via the SystemCallArchitectures= option in the global configuration. See systemd-system.conf(5) for details.
系统调用架构也可以通过全局配置中的 SystemCallArchitectures= 选项在整个系统范围内受限。有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd-system.conf(5)。

Added in version 209. 在版本 209 中添加。

SystemCallLog=¶

Takes a space-separated list of system call names. If this setting is used, all system calls executed by the unit processes for the listed ones will be logged. If the first character of the list is "~", the effect is inverted: all system calls except the listed system calls will be logged. This feature makes use of the Secure Computing Mode 2 interfaces of the kernel ('seccomp filtering') and is useful for auditing or setting up a minimal sandboxing environment. This option may be specified more than once, in which case the filter masks are merged. If the empty string is assigned, the filter is reset, all prior assignments will have no effect. This does not affect commands prefixed with "+".
接受一个以空格分隔的系统调用名称列表。如果使用此设置，所有列出的系统调用由单元进程执行，将被记录。如果列表的第一个字符是 " ~ "，则效果是反转的：除列出的系统调用外，所有系统调用都将被记录。此功能利用内核的安全计算模式 2 接口（'seccomp 过滤'）实现，并可用于审计或设置最小化沙盒环境。可以多次指定此选项，此时过滤器掩码将被合并。如果分配空字符串，则过滤器将被重置，所有先前的分配将不起作用。这不会影响以 " + " 为前缀的命令。

Added in version 247. 在版本 247 中添加。

Environment¶ 环境 ¶

Environment=¶

Sets environment variables for executed processes. Each line is unquoted using the rules described in "Quoting" section in systemd.syntax(7) and becomes a list of variable assignments. If you need to assign a value containing spaces or the equals sign to a variable, put quotes around the whole assignment. Variable expansion is not performed inside the strings and the "$" character has no special meaning. Specifier expansion is performed, see the "Specifiers" section in systemd.unit(5).
为执行的进程设置环境变量。每行都使用 systemd.syntax(7) 中描述的“引用”部分的规则进行非引用处理，并成为变量赋值列表。如果需要为变量分配包含空格或等号的值，请在整个赋值周围加上引号。变量扩展不会在字符串内执行，“ $ ”字符没有特殊含义。执行规范扩展，请参阅 systemd.unit(5) 中的“规范”部分。

This option may be specified more than once, in which case all listed variables will be set. If the same variable is listed twice, the later setting will override the earlier setting. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the list of environment variables is reset, all prior assignments have no effect.
可以多次指定此选项，这样所有列出的变量都将被设置。如果同一变量列出两次，则后面的设置将覆盖先前的设置。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则环境变量列表将被重置，所有先前的赋值都不起作用。

The names of the variables can contain ASCII letters, digits, and the underscore character. Variable names cannot be empty or start with a digit. In variable values, most characters are allowed, but non-printable characters are currently rejected.
变量的名称可以包含 ASCII 字母、数字和下划线字符。变量名称不能为空，也不能以数字开头。在变量值中，允许大多数字符，但目前拒绝非可打印字符。

Example:  示例：

Environment="VAR1=word1 word2" VAR2=word3 "VAR3=$word 5 6"

gives three variables "VAR1", "VAR2", "VAR3" with the values "word1 word2", "word3", "$word 5 6".
给出三个变量 " VAR1 "，" VAR2 "，" VAR3 "，其值分别为 " word1 word2 "，" word3 "，" $word 5 6 "。

See environ(7) for details about environment variables.
有关环境变量的详细信息，请参阅 environ(7)。

Note that environment variables are not suitable for passing secrets (such as passwords, key material, …) to service processes. Environment variables set for a unit are exposed to unprivileged clients via D-Bus IPC, and generally not understood as being data that requires protection. Moreover, environment variables are propagated down the process tree, including across security boundaries (such as setuid/setgid executables), and hence might leak to processes that should not have access to the secret data. Use LoadCredential=, LoadCredentialEncrypted= or SetCredentialEncrypted= (see below) to pass data to unit processes securely.
请注意，环境变量不适合用于传递机密信息（如密码、密钥材料等）给服务进程。为单元设置的环境变量通过 D-Bus IPC 向非特权客户端公开，并且通常不被视为需要保护的数据。此外，环境变量会向下传播到进程树，包括跨安全边界（如 setuid/setgid 可执行文件），因此可能会泄漏给不应访问秘密数据的进程。使用 LoadCredential= ， LoadCredentialEncrypted= 或 SetCredentialEncrypted= （见下文）安全地传递数据给单元进程。

EnvironmentFile=¶

Similar to Environment=, but reads the environment variables from a text file. The text file should contain newline-separated variable assignments. Empty lines, lines without an "=" separator, or lines starting with ";" or "#" will be ignored, which may be used for commenting. The file must be encoded with UTF-8. Valid characters are unicode scalar values other than unicode noncharacters, U+0000 NUL, and U+FEFF unicode byte order mark. Control codes other than NUL are allowed.
与 Environment= 类似，但从文本文件中读取环境变量。文本文件应包含换行分隔的变量赋值。空行、没有 " = " 分隔符的行，或以 " ; " 或 " # " 开头的行将被忽略，可用于注释。文件必须使用 UTF-8 编码。有效字符是除了 Unicode 非字符、 U+0000 NUL 和 U+FEFF Unicode 字节顺序标记之外的 Unicode 标量值。除了 NUL 之外的控制码是允许的。

In the file, an unquoted value after the "=" is parsed with the same backslash-escape rules as POSIX shell unquoted text, but unlike in a shell, interior whitespace is preserved and quotes after the first non-whitespace character are preserved. Leading and trailing whitespace (space, tab, carriage return) is discarded, but interior whitespace within the line is preserved verbatim. A line ending with a backslash will be continued to the following one, with the newline itself discarded. A backslash "\" followed by any character other than newline will preserve the following character, so that "\\" will become the value "\".
在文件中，" = " 后面的未引用值将使用与 POSIX shell 未引用文本相同的反斜杠转义规则解析，但与 shell 不同，内部空白将被保留，第一个非空白字符后的引号将被保留。前导和尾随空白（空格、制表符、回车）将被丢弃，但行内的内部空白将被原样保留。以反斜杠结尾的行将继续到下一行，换行符本身将被丢弃。反斜杠 " \ " 后面跟随除换行符之外的任何字符将保留后面的字符，以便 " \\ " 将成为值 " \ "。

In the file, a "'"-quoted value after the "=" can span multiple lines and contain any character verbatim other than single quote, like POSIX shell single-quoted text. No backslash-escape sequences are recognized. Leading and trailing whitespace outside of the single quotes is discarded.
在文件中，“ ' ”之后的“ = ”引号引起的值可以跨越多行，并且可以包含除单引号之外的任何字符，就像 POSIX shell 中的单引号文本一样。不识别反斜杠转义序列。单引号之外的前导和尾随空格会被丢弃。

In the file, a """-quoted value after the "=" can span multiple lines, and the same escape sequences are recognized as in POSIX shell double-quoted text. Backslash ("\") followed by any of ""\`$" will preserve that character. A backslash followed by newline is a line continuation, and the newline itself is discarded. A backslash followed by any other character is ignored; both the backslash and the following character are preserved verbatim. Leading and trailing whitespace outside of the double quotes is discarded.
在文件中，“ " ”之后的“ = ”引号引起的值可以跨越多行，并且与 POSIX shell 中的双引号文本相同，识别相同的转义序列。反斜杠（“ \ ”）后跟任何“ "\`$ ”将保留该字符。反斜杠后跟换行符是行续行，换行符本身会被丢弃。反斜杠后跟任何其他字符都会被忽略；反斜杠和后续字符都会被原样保留。双引号之外的前导和尾随空格会被丢弃。

The argument passed should be an absolute filename or wildcard expression, optionally prefixed with "-", which indicates that if the file does not exist, it will not be read and no error or warning message is logged. This option may be specified more than once in which case all specified files are read. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the list of file to read is reset, all prior assignments have no effect.
传递的参数应为绝对文件名或通配符表达式，可选择地以“ - ”为前缀，表示如果文件不存在，则不会被读取，也不会记录任何错误或警告消息。可以多次指定此选项，在这种情况下，将读取所有指定的文件。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则将重置要读取的文件列表，所有先前的分配都不起作用。

The files listed with this directive will be read shortly before the process is executed (more specifically, after all processes from a previous unit state terminated. This means you can generate these files in one unit state, and read it with this option in the next. The files are read from the file system of the service manager, before any file system changes like bind mounts take place).
使用此指令列出的文件将在进程执行之前不久被读取（更具体地说，在前一个单元状态的所有进程终止之后）。这意味着您可以在一个单元状态中生成这些文件，并在下一个单元状态中使用此选项读取它。这些文件是从服务管理器的文件系统中读取的，在进行任何文件系统更改（如绑定挂载）之前。

Settings from these files override settings made with Environment=. If the same variable is set twice from these files, the files will be read in the order they are specified and the later setting will override the earlier setting.
这些文件中的设置将覆盖使用 Environment= 进行的设置。如果同一变量从这些文件中设置两次，则将按照它们指定的顺序读取文件，并且后面的设置将覆盖先前的设置。

PassEnvironment=¶

Pass environment variables set for the system service manager to executed processes. Takes a space-separated list of variable names. This option may be specified more than once, in which case all listed variables will be passed. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the list of environment variables to pass is reset, all prior assignments have no effect. Variables specified that are not set for the system manager will not be passed and will be silently ignored. Note that this option is only relevant for the system service manager, as system services by default do not automatically inherit any environment variables set for the service manager itself. However, in case of the user service manager all environment variables are passed to the executed processes anyway, hence this option is without effect for the user service manager.
将为系统服务管理器设置的环境变量传递给执行的进程。接受一个以空格分隔的变量名称列表。可以多次指定此选项，在这种情况下，将传递所有列出的变量。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则将重置要传递的环境变量列表，所有先前的分配都不起作用。未设置为系统管理器的变量将不会被传递，并将被静默忽略。请注意，此选项仅适用于系统服务管理器，因为系统服务默认情况下不会自动继承为服务管理器本身设置的任何环境变量。但是，在用户服务管理器的情况下，所有环境变量都会被传递给执行的进程，因此此选项对用户服务管理器无效。

Variables set for invoked processes due to this setting are subject to being overridden by those configured with Environment= or EnvironmentFile=.
由于此设置而为调用进程设置的变量可能会被使用 Environment= 或 EnvironmentFile= 配置的变量覆盖。

Example:  示例：

PassEnvironment=VAR1 VAR2 VAR3

passes three variables "VAR1", "VAR2", "VAR3" with the values set for those variables in PID1.
传递三个变量" VAR1 "，" VAR2 "，" VAR3 "，其值设置为 PID1 中这些变量的值。

See environ(7) for details about environment variables.
有关环境变量的详细信息，请参阅 environ(7)。

Added in version 228. 添加在版本 228 中。

UnsetEnvironment=¶

Explicitly unset environment variable assignments that would normally be passed from the service manager to invoked processes of this unit. Takes a space-separated list of variable names or variable assignments. This option may be specified more than once, in which case all listed variables/assignments will be unset. If the empty string is assigned to this option, the list of environment variables/assignments to unset is reset. If a variable assignment is specified (that is: a variable name, followed by "=", followed by its value), then any environment variable matching this precise assignment is removed. If a variable name is specified (that is a variable name without any following "=" or value), then any assignment matching the variable name, regardless of its value is removed. Note that the effect of UnsetEnvironment= is applied as final step when the environment list passed to executed processes is compiled. That means it may undo assignments from any configuration source, including assignments made through Environment= or EnvironmentFile=, inherited from the system manager's global set of environment variables, inherited via PassEnvironment=, set by the service manager itself (such as $NOTIFY_SOCKET and such), or set by a PAM module (in case PAMName= is used).
明确取消通常从服务管理器传递给此单元的调用进程的环境变量赋值。接受一个以空格分隔的变量名称或变量赋值列表。此选项可以指定多次，这样所有列出的变量/赋值都将被取消设置。如果将空字符串分配给此选项，则将重置要取消设置的环境变量/赋值列表。如果指定了变量赋值（即：变量名称，后跟“ = ”，后跟其值），则将删除匹配此精确赋值的任何环境变量。如果指定了变量名称（即变量名称而没有后续的“ = ”或值），则将删除匹配变量名称的任何赋值，而不管其值如何。请注意， UnsetEnvironment= 的效果将作为编译到执行进程的环境列表的最后一步应用。 这意味着它可能会撤消从任何配置源（包括通过 Environment= 或 EnvironmentFile= 进行的分配，从系统管理器的全局环境变量集继承，通过 PassEnvironment= 继承，由服务管理器本身设置（例如 $NOTIFY_SOCKET 等），或由 PAM 模块设置（如果使用 PAMName= ）。

See "Environment Variables in Spawned Processes" below for a description of how those settings combine to form the inherited environment. See environ(7) for general information about environment variables.
有关这些设置如何组合形成继承环境的描述，请参见下文的“生成进程中的环境变量”。有关环境变量的一般信息，请参见 environ(7)。

Added in version 235. 在版本 235 中添加。

Logging and Standard Input/Output¶
记录和标准输入/输出 ¶

StandardInput=¶

Controls where file descriptor 0 (STDIN) of the executed processes is connected to. Takes one of null, tty, tty-force, tty-fail, data, file:path, socket or fd:name.
控制执行进程的文件描述符 0 (STDIN) 连接到的位置。取值为 null 、 tty 、 tty-force 、 tty-fail 、 data 、 file:path 、 socket 或 fd:name 之一。

If null is selected, standard input will be connected to /dev/null, i.e. all read attempts by the process will result in immediate EOF.
如果选择 null ，标准输入将连接到 /dev/null ，即进程的所有读取尝试都将立即导致 EOF。

If tty is selected, standard input is connected to a TTY (as configured by TTYPath=, see below) and the executed process becomes the controlling process of the terminal. If the terminal is already being controlled by another process, the executed process waits until the current controlling process releases the terminal.
如果选择 tty ，标准输入将连接到一个 TTY（由 TTYPath= 配置，见下文），并且执行的进程将成为终端的控制进程。如果终端已经被另一个进程控制，执行的进程将等待当前控制进程释放终端。

tty-force is similar to tty, but the executed process is forcefully and immediately made the controlling process of the terminal, potentially removing previous controlling processes from the terminal.
tty-force 类似于 tty ，但执行的进程会被强制立即成为终端的控制进程，可能会移除先前的控制进程。

tty-fail is similar to tty, but if the terminal already has a controlling process start-up of the executed process fails.
tty-fail 类似于 tty ，但如果终端已经有一个控制进程，执行进程的启动将失败。

The data option may be used to configure arbitrary textual or binary data to pass via standard input to the executed process. The data to pass is configured via StandardInputText=/StandardInputData= (see below). Note that the actual file descriptor type passed (memory file, regular file, UNIX pipe, …) might depend on the kernel and available privileges. In any case, the file descriptor is read-only, and when read returns the specified data followed by EOF.
data 选项可用于配置要通过标准输入传递给执行进程的任意文本或二进制数据。要传递的数据是通过 StandardInputText= / StandardInputData= 配置的（见下文）。请注意，传递的实际文件描述符类型（内存文件、常规文件、UNIX 管道等）可能取决于内核和可用权限。无论如何，文件描述符是只读的，读取时返回指定数据，然后是 EOF。

The file:path option may be used to connect a specific file system object to standard input. An absolute path following the ":" character is expected, which may refer to a regular file, a FIFO or special file. If an AF_UNIX socket in the file system is specified, a stream socket is connected to it. The latter is useful for connecting standard input of processes to arbitrary system services.
file:path 选项可用于将特定文件系统对象连接到标准输入。预期跟在“ : ”字符后面的是绝对路径，可以是常规文件、FIFO 或特殊文件。如果指定了文件系统中的 AF_UNIX 套接字，则会将流套接字连接到它。后者对于将进程的标准输入连接到任意系统服务非常有用。

The socket option is valid in socket-activated services only, and requires the relevant socket unit file (see systemd.socket(5) for details) to have Accept=yes set, or to specify a single socket only. If this option is set, standard input will be connected to the socket the service was activated from, which is primarily useful for compatibility with daemons designed for use with the traditional inetd(8) socket activation daemon ($LISTEN_FDS (and related) environment variables are not passed when socket value is configured).
socket 选项仅在套接字激活服务中有效，并且要求相关的套接字单元文件（有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.socket(5)）设置为 Accept=yes ，或者仅指定一个套接字。如果设置了此选项，标准输入将连接到服务从中激活的套接字，这对于与传统 inetd(8) 套接字激活守护程序兼容的守护程序设计非常有用（当配置了 socket 值时，不传递 $LISTEN_FDS （及相关）环境变量）。

The fd:name option connects standard input to a specific, named file descriptor provided by a socket unit. The name may be specified as part of this option, following a ":" character (e.g. "fd:foobar"). If no name is specified, the name "stdin" is implied (i.e. "fd" is equivalent to "fd:stdin"). At least one socket unit defining the specified name must be provided via the Sockets= option, and the file descriptor name may differ from the name of its containing socket unit. If multiple matches are found, the first one will be used. See FileDescriptorName= in systemd.socket(5) for more details about named file descriptors and their ordering.
" fd:name 选项将标准输入连接到套接字单元提供的特定命名文件描述符。名称可以作为此选项的一部分指定，在一个“ : ”字符后面（例如，“ fd:foobar ”）。如果未指定名称，则暗示名称“ stdin ”（即，“ fd ”等同于“ fd:stdin ”）。必须通过 Sockets= 选项提供至少一个定义了指定名称的套接字单元，并且文件描述符名称可能与其包含的套接字单元的名称不同。如果找到多个匹配项，将使用第一个匹配项。有关命名文件描述符及其排序的更多详细信息，请参阅 systemd.socket(5) 中的 FileDescriptorName= 。

This setting defaults to null, unless StandardInputText=/StandardInputData= are set, in which case it defaults to data.
该设置默认为 null ，除非设置了 StandardInputText= / StandardInputData= ，在这种情况下默认为 data 。

StandardOutput=¶

Controls where file descriptor 1 (stdout) of the executed processes is connected to. Takes one of inherit, null, tty, journal, kmsg, journal+console, kmsg+console, file:path, append:path, truncate:path, socket or fd:name.
控制执行进程的文件描述符 1（标准输出）连接到的位置。取其中之一 inherit ， null ， tty ， journal ， kmsg ， journal+console ， kmsg+console ， file:path ， append:path ， truncate:path ， socket 或 fd:name 。

inherit duplicates the file descriptor of standard input for standard output.
inherit 复制标准输入的文件描述符以用于标准输出。

null connects standard output to /dev/null, i.e. everything written to it will be lost.
null 将标准输出连接到 /dev/null ，即写入的所有内容都将丢失。

tty connects standard output to a tty (as configured via TTYPath=, see below). If the TTY is used for output only, the executed process will not become the controlling process of the terminal, and will not fail or wait for other processes to release the terminal.
tty 将标准输出连接到 tty（如通过 TTYPath= 配置的），请参见下文。如果 TTY 仅用于输出，则执行的进程将不会成为终端的控制进程，并且不会因其他进程未释放终端而失败或等待。

journal connects standard output with the journal, which is accessible via journalctl(1). Note that everything that is written to kmsg (see below) is implicitly stored in the journal as well, the specific option listed below is hence a superset of this one. (Also note that any external, additional syslog daemons receive their log data from the journal, too, hence this is the option to use when logging shall be processed with such a daemon.)
journal 将标准输出连接到日志，可通过 journalctl(1) 访问。请注意，写入 kmsg（请参见下文）的所有内容也会隐式存储在日志中，因此下面列出的特定选项是此选项的超集。（还请注意，任何外部的附加 syslog 守护程序也会从日志接收其日志数据，因此在希望使用此类守护程序处理日志记录时，请使用此选项。）

kmsg connects standard output with the kernel log buffer which is accessible via dmesg(1), in addition to the journal. The journal daemon might be configured to send all logs to kmsg anyway, in which case this option is no different from journal.
kmsg 将标准输出连接到内核日志缓冲区，可以通过 dmesg(1) 访问，除了日志记录。如果日志记录守护程序已配置为将所有日志发送到 kmsg，那么此选项与 journal 没有区别。

journal+console and kmsg+console work in a similar way as the two options above but copy the output to the system console as well.
journal+console 和 kmsg+console 与上述两个选项的工作方式类似，但也将输出复制到系统控制台。

The file:path option may be used to connect a specific file system object to standard output. The semantics are similar to the same option of StandardInput=, see above. If path refers to a regular file on the filesystem, it is opened (created if it doesn't exist yet) for writing at the beginning of the file, but without truncating it. If standard input and output are directed to the same file path, it is opened only once — for reading as well as writing — and duplicated. This is particularly useful when the specified path refers to an AF_UNIX socket in the file system, as in that case only a single stream connection is created for both input and output.
file:path 选项可用于将特定文件系统对象连接到标准输出。语义与 StandardInput= 的相同选项类似，详见上文。如果 path 指的是文件系统上的常规文件，则会在文件开头打开（如果尚不存在则创建）以进行写入，但不会截断它。如果标准输入和输出定向到相同的文件路径，则只会打开一次 — 用于读取和写入 — 并复制。当指定的路径指向文件系统中的 AF_UNIX 套接字时，这将特别有用，因为在这种情况下，仅为输入和输出创建单个流连接。

append:path is similar to file:path above, but it opens the file in append mode.
append:path 类似于上面的 file:path ，但它以追加模式打开文件。

truncate:path is similar to file:path above, but it truncates the file when opening it. For units with multiple command lines, e.g. Type=oneshot services with multiple ExecStart=, or services with ExecCondition=, ExecStartPre= or ExecStartPost=, the output file is reopened and therefore re-truncated for each command line. If the output file is truncated while another process still has the file open, e.g. by an ExecReload= running concurrently with an ExecStart=, and the other process continues writing to the file without adjusting its offset, then the space between the file pointers of the two processes may be filled with NUL bytes, producing a sparse file. Thus, truncate:path is typically only useful for units where only one process runs at a time, such as services with a single ExecStart= and no ExecStartPost=, ExecReload=, ExecStop= or similar.
truncate:path 类似于上面的 file:path ，但在打开文件时会截断文件。对于具有多个命令行的单元，例如具有多个 ExecStart= 的服务，或具有 ExecCondition= 、 ExecStartPre= 或 ExecStartPost= 的服务，输出文件会被重新打开，因此对于每个命令行都会重新截断。如果在另一个进程仍然打开文件的情况下截断输出文件，例如由与 ExecStart= 并发运行的 ExecReload= 打开，而另一个进程继续写入文件而不调整其偏移量，则两个进程的文件指针之间的空间可能会被填充为 NUL 字节，从而产生稀疏文件。因此， truncate:path 通常仅对仅有一个进程运行的单元有用，例如具有单个 ExecStart= 且没有 ExecStartPost= 、 ExecReload= 、 ExecStop= 或类似内容的服务。

socket connects standard output to a socket acquired via socket activation. The semantics are similar to the same option of StandardInput=, see above.
socket 将标准输出连接到通过套接字激活获取的套接字。语义与 StandardInput= 的相同选项类似，参见上文。

The fd:name option connects standard output to a specific, named file descriptor provided by a socket unit. A name may be specified as part of this option, following a ":" character (e.g. "fd:foobar"). If no name is specified, the name "stdout" is implied (i.e. "fd" is equivalent to "fd:stdout"). At least one socket unit defining the specified name must be provided via the Sockets= option, and the file descriptor name may differ from the name of its containing socket unit. If multiple matches are found, the first one will be used. See FileDescriptorName= in systemd.socket(5) for more details about named descriptors and their ordering.
fd:name 选项将标准输出连接到由套接字单元提供的特定命名文件描述符。可以在此选项的一部分中指定名称，后跟“ : ”字符（例如“ fd:foobar ”）。如果未指定名称，则暗示名称“ stdout ”（即“ fd ”等同于“ fd:stdout ”）。必须通过 Sockets= 选项提供定义指定名称的至少一个套接字单元，并且文件描述符名称可能与其包含的套接字单元的名称不同。如果找到多个匹配项，则将使用第一个。有关命名描述符及其排序的更多详细信息，请参见 systemd.socket(5) 中的 FileDescriptorName= 。

If the standard output (or error output, see below) of a unit is connected to the journal or the kernel log buffer, the unit will implicitly gain a dependency of type After= on systemd-journald.socket (also see the "Implicit Dependencies" section above). Also note that in this case stdout (or stderr, see below) will be an AF_UNIX stream socket, and not a pipe or FIFO that can be re-opened. This means when executing shell scripts the construct echo "hello" > /dev/stderr for writing text to stderr will not work. To mitigate this use the construct echo "hello" >&2 instead, which is mostly equivalent and avoids this pitfall.
如果一个单元的标准输出（或错误输出，请参见下文）连接到日志或内核日志缓冲区，则该单元将隐式获得对 systemd-journald.socket 的 After= 类型依赖（还请参见上文的“隐式依赖”部分）。还请注意，在这种情况下，stdout（或 stderr，请参见下文）将是一个 AF_UNIX 流套接字，而不是可以重新打开的管道或 FIFO。这意味着在执行 shell 脚本时，用于将文本写入 stderr 的构造 echo "hello" > /dev/stderr 将不起作用。为了减轻这种情况，请改用 echo "hello" >&2，这在很大程度上是等效的，并避免了这种陷阱。

If StandardInput= is set to one of tty, tty-force, tty-fail, socket, or fd:name, this setting defaults to inherit.
如果 StandardInput= 设置为 tty 之一，则此设置默认为 inherit 。

In other cases, this setting defaults to the value set with DefaultStandardOutput= in systemd-system.conf(5), which defaults to journal. Note that setting this parameter might result in additional dependencies to be added to the unit (see above).
在其他情况下，此设置默认为 systemd-system.conf(5) 中设置的值，默认为 journal 。请注意，设置此参数可能导致向该单元添加其他依赖项（请参见上文）。

StandardError=¶

Controls where file descriptor 2 (stderr) of the executed processes is connected to. The available options are identical to those of StandardOutput=, with some exceptions: if set to inherit the file descriptor used for standard output is duplicated for standard error, while fd:name will use a default file descriptor name of "stderr".
控制执行进程的文件描述符 2（stderr）连接到的位置。可用选项与 StandardOutput= 相同，但有一些例外：如果设置为 inherit ，则用于标准输出的文件描述符将复制为标准错误，而 fd:name 将使用默认的文件描述符名称“ stderr ”。

This setting defaults to the value set with DefaultStandardError= in systemd-system.conf(5), which defaults to inherit. Note that setting this parameter might result in additional dependencies to be added to the unit (see above).
此设置默认为 systemd-system.conf(5)中设置的值，默认为 inherit 。请注意，设置此参数可能会导致为单元添加额外的依赖项（请参见上文）。

StandardInputText=, StandardInputData=¶  StandardInputText= ， StandardInputData= ¶

Configures arbitrary textual or binary data to pass via file descriptor 0 (STDIN) to the executed processes. These settings have no effect unless StandardInput= is set to data (which is the default if StandardInput= is not set otherwise, but StandardInputText=/StandardInputData= is). Use this option to embed process input data directly in the unit file.
配置通过文件描述符 0（STDIN）传递的任意文本或二进制数据给执行的进程。除非 StandardInput= 设置为 data （如果未设置 StandardInput= ，则默认为 StandardInputText= / StandardInputData= ），否则这些设置不起作用。使用此选项直接在单元文件中嵌入进程输入数据。

StandardInputText= accepts arbitrary textual data. C-style escapes for special characters as well as the usual "%"-specifiers are resolved. Each time this setting is used the specified text is appended to the per-unit data buffer, followed by a newline character (thus every use appends a new line to the end of the buffer). Note that leading and trailing whitespace of lines configured with this option is removed. If an empty line is specified the buffer is cleared (hence, in order to insert an empty line, add an additional "\n" to the end or beginning of a line).
StandardInputText= 接受任意文本数据。特殊字符的 C 风格转义以及通常的" % "格式化符号都会被解析。每次使用此设置时，指定的文本都会被附加到每个单元数据缓冲区的末尾，后面跟着一个换行符（因此每次使用都会在缓冲区末尾附加一个新行）。请注意，使用此选项配置的行的前导和尾随空格将被移除。如果指定了空行，则缓冲区将被清除（因此，为了插入空行，请在行的末尾或开头添加额外的" \n "）。

StandardInputData= accepts arbitrary binary data, encoded in Base64. No escape sequences or specifiers are resolved. Any whitespace in the encoded version is ignored during decoding.
StandardInputData= 接受任意二进制数据，以 Base64 编码。不会解析任何转义序列或格式化符号。在解码过程中，编码版本中的任何空格都将被忽略。

Note that StandardInputText= and StandardInputData= operate on the same data buffer, and may be mixed in order to configure both binary and textual data for the same input stream. The textual or binary data is joined strictly in the order the settings appear in the unit file. Assigning an empty string to either will reset the data buffer.
请注意， StandardInputText= 和 StandardInputData= 操作在同一数据缓冲区上，并且可以混合使用以配置相同输入流的二进制和文本数据。文本或二进制数据严格按照单元文件中设置出现的顺序连接。将空字符串分配给任一项都将重置数据缓冲区。

Please keep in mind that in order to maintain readability long unit file settings may be split into multiple lines, by suffixing each line (except for the last) with a "\" character (see systemd.unit(5) for details). This is particularly useful for large data configured with these two options. Example:
请记住，为了保持可读性，长单元文件设置可能会被拆分为多行，通过在每行（除最后一行外）后缀加上一个 " \ " 字符（有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.unit(5)）。这对于使用这两个选项配置的大型数据特别有用。示例：

…
StandardInput=data
StandardInputData=V2XigLJyZSBubyBzdHJhbmdlcnMgdG8gbG92ZQpZb3Uga25vdyB0aGUgcnVsZXMgYW5kIHNvIGRv \
                  IEkKQSBmdWxsIGNvbW1pdG1lbnQncyB3aGF0IEnigLJtIHRoaW5raW5nIG9mCllvdSB3b3VsZG4n \
                  dCBnZXQgdGhpcyBmcm9tIGFueSBvdGhlciBndXkKSSBqdXN0IHdhbm5hIHRlbGwgeW91IGhvdyBJ \
                  J20gZmVlbGluZwpHb3R0YSBtYWtlIHlvdSB1bmRlcnN0YW5kCgpOZXZlciBnb25uYSBnaXZlIHlv \
                  dSB1cApOZXZlciBnb25uYSBsZXQgeW91IGRvd24KTmV2ZXIgZ29ubmEgcnVuIGFyb3VuZCBhbmQg \
                  ZGVzZXJ0IHlvdQpOZXZlciBnb25uYSBtYWtlIHlvdSBjcnkKTmV2ZXIgZ29ubmEgc2F5IGdvb2Ri \
                  eWUKTmV2ZXIgZ29ubmEgdGVsbCBhIGxpZSBhbmQgaHVydCB5b3UK
…

Added in version 236. 在版本 236 中添加。

LogLevelMax=¶

Configures filtering by log level of log messages generated by this unit. Takes a syslog log level, one of emerg (lowest log level, only highest priority messages), alert, crit, err, warning, notice, info, debug (highest log level, also lowest priority messages). See syslog(3) for details. By default no filtering is applied (i.e. the default maximum log level is debug). Use this option to configure the logging system to drop log messages of a specific service above the specified level. For example, set LogLevelMax=info in order to turn off debug logging of a particularly chatty unit. Note that the configured level is applied to any log messages written by any of the processes belonging to this unit, as well as any log messages written by the system manager process (PID 1) in reference to this unit, sent via any supported logging protocol. The filtering is applied early in the logging pipeline, before any kind of further processing is done. Moreover, messages which pass through this filter successfully might still be dropped by filters applied at a later stage in the logging subsystem. For example, MaxLevelStore= configured in journald.conf(5) might prohibit messages of higher log levels to be stored on disk, even though the per-unit LogLevelMax= permitted it to be processed.
配置此单元生成的日志消息的日志级别过滤。输入一个 syslog 日志级别，其中之一为 emerg （最低日志级别，仅最高优先级消息）， alert ， crit ， err ， warning ， notice ， info ， debug （最高日志级别，也是最低优先级消息）。有关详细信息，请参阅 syslog(3)。默认情况下不应用任何过滤（即默认最大日志级别为 debug ）。使用此选项配置日志系统以丢弃特定服务的日志消息高于指定级别。例如，设置 LogLevelMax= info 以关闭特别啰嗦单元的调试日志记录。请注意，配置的级别适用于由此单元的任何进程编写的任何日志消息，以及由系统管理器进程（PID 1）编写的任何与此单元相关的日志消息，通过任何支持的日志记录协议发送。过滤器在日志管道的早期应用，之前不会进行任何进一步的处理。此外，成功通过此过滤器的消息仍可能被应用在日志子系统后阶段的过滤器丢弃。例如， MaxLevelStore= 在 journald 中配置。conf(5)可能会禁止将更高日志级别的消息存储在磁盘上，即使每个单元 LogLevelMax= 允许将其处理。

Added in version 236. 在版本 236 中添加。

LogExtraFields=¶

Configures additional log metadata fields to include in all log records generated by processes associated with this unit, including systemd. This setting takes one or more journal field assignments in the format "FIELD=VALUE" separated by whitespace. See systemd.journal-fields(7) for details on the journal field concept. Even though the underlying journal implementation permits binary field values, this setting accepts only valid UTF-8 values. To include space characters in a journal field value, enclose the assignment in double quotes ("). The usual specifiers are expanded in all assignments (see below). Note that this setting is not only useful for attaching additional metadata to log records of a unit, but given that all fields and values are indexed may also be used to implement cross-unit log record matching. Assign an empty string to reset the list.
配置要在与该单元关联的进程生成的所有日志记录中包含的附加日志元数据字段，包括 systemd。此设置采用以空格分隔的格式“ FIELD=VALUE ”中的一个或多个日志字段赋值。有关日志字段概念的详细信息，请参阅 systemd.journal-fields(7)。即使底层日志实现允许二进制字段值，此设置也仅接受有效的 UTF-8 值。要在日志字段值中包含空格字符，请用双引号（“）括起赋值。所有赋值中都会展开常规的指定符号（请参阅下文）。请注意，此设置不仅对于将附加元数据附加到单元的日志记录很有用，而且由于所有字段和值都被索引，因此也可用于实现跨单元日志记录匹配。将空字符串分配以重置列表。

Added in version 236. 在版本 236 中添加。

LogRateLimitIntervalSec=, LogRateLimitBurst=¶  LogRateLimitIntervalSec= ， LogRateLimitBurst= ¶

Configures the rate limiting that is applied to log messages generated by this unit. If, in the time interval defined by LogRateLimitIntervalSec=, more messages than specified in LogRateLimitBurst= are logged by a service, all further messages within the interval are dropped until the interval is over. A message about the number of dropped messages is generated. The time specification for LogRateLimitIntervalSec= may be specified in the following units: "s", "min", "h", "ms", "us". See systemd.time(7) for details. The default settings are set by RateLimitIntervalSec= and RateLimitBurst= configured in journald.conf(5). Note that this only applies to log messages that are processed by the logging subsystem, i.e. by systemd-journald.service(8). This means that if you connect a service's stderr directly to a file via StandardOutput=file:… or a similar setting, the rate limiting will not be applied to messages written that way (but it will be enforced for messages generated via syslog(3) and similar functions).
配置应用于此单元生成的日志消息的速率限制。如果在由 LogRateLimitIntervalSec= 定义的时间间隔内，某个服务记录的消息数量超过 LogRateLimitBurst= 指定的数量，则在该时间间隔内进一步的所有消息都将被丢弃，直到时间间隔结束。将生成有关已丢弃消息数量的消息。 LogRateLimitIntervalSec= 的时间规范可以用以下单位指定："s"、"min"、"h"、"ms"、"us"。有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.time(7)。默认设置由 journald.conf(5)中配置的 RateLimitIntervalSec= 和 RateLimitBurst= 设置。请注意，这仅适用于由日志记录子系统处理的日志消息，即由 systemd-journald.service(8)处理。这意味着，如果您通过 StandardOutput=file:… 或类似设置直接将服务的 stderr 连接到文件，则不会对以这种方式编写的消息应用速率限制（但对通过 syslog(3)和类似功能生成的消息将执行强制执行）。

Added in version 240. 在版本 240 中添加。

LogFilterPatterns=¶

Define an extended regular expression to filter log messages based on the MESSAGE= field of the structured message. If the first character of the pattern is "~", log entries matching the pattern should be discarded. This option takes a single pattern as an argument but can be used multiple times to create a list of allowed and denied patterns. If the empty string is assigned, the filter is reset, and all prior assignments will have no effect.
定义一个扩展的正则表达式，根据结构化消息的 MESSAGE= 字段过滤日志消息。如果模式的第一个字符是 " ~ "，则应丢弃与模式匹配的日志条目。此选项将一个模式作为参数，但可以多次使用以创建允许和拒绝模式的列表。如果分配空字符串，则过滤器将被重置，并且所有先前的分配将不起作用。

Because the "~" character is used to define denied patterns, it must be replaced with "\x7e" to allow a message starting with "~". For example, "~foobar" would add a pattern matching "foobar" to the deny list, while "\x7efoobar" would add a pattern matching "~foobar" to the allow list.
因为 " ~ " 字符用于定义拒绝模式，所以必须用 " \x7e " 替换它以允许以 " ~ " 开头的消息。例如，" ~foobar " 将添加一个匹配 " foobar " 的模式到拒绝列表，而" \x7efoobar " 将添加一个匹配 " ~foobar " 的模式到允许列表。

Log messages are tested against denied patterns (if any), then against allowed patterns (if any). If a log message matches any of the denied patterns, it will be discarded, whatever the allowed patterns. Then, remaining log messages are tested against allowed patterns. Messages matching against none of the allowed pattern are discarded. If no allowed patterns are defined, then all messages are processed directly after going through denied filters.
日志消息首先根据拒绝模式（如果有）进行测试，然后根据允许模式（如果有）进行测试。如果日志消息与任何拒绝模式匹配，它将被丢弃，无论允许模式如何。然后，剩余的日志消息将根据允许模式进行测试。与任何允许模式都不匹配的消息将被丢弃。如果未定义任何允许模式，则所有消息在经过拒绝过滤器后将直接处理。

Filtering is based on the unit for which LogFilterPatterns= is defined, meaning log messages coming from systemd(1) about the unit are not taken into account. Filtered log messages won't be forwarded to traditional syslog daemons, the kernel log buffer (kmsg), the systemd console, or sent as wall messages to all logged-in users.
过滤是基于定义 LogFilterPatterns= 的单元进行的，这意味着来自 systemd(1)关于该单元的日志消息不会被考虑在内。过滤后的日志消息不会被转发到传统的 syslog 守护程序、内核日志缓冲区（kmsg）、systemd 控制台，也不会作为墙消息发送给所有已登录用户。

Added in version 253. 在版本 253 中添加。

LogNamespace=¶

Run the unit's processes in the specified journal namespace. Expects a short user-defined string identifying the namespace. If not used the processes of the service are run in the default journal namespace, i.e. their log stream is collected and processed by systemd-journald.service. If this option is used any log data generated by processes of this unit (regardless if via the syslog(), journal native logging or stdout/stderr logging) is collected and processed by an instance of the systemd-journald@.service template unit, which manages the specified namespace. The log data is stored in a data store independent from the default log namespace's data store. See systemd-journald.service(8) for details about journal namespaces.
在指定的日志命名空间中运行单元的进程。需要一个简短的用户定义字符串来标识命名空间。如果不使用，服务的进程将在默认的日志命名空间中运行，即它们的日志流由 systemd-journald.service 收集和处理。如果使用了此选项，由该单元的进程生成的任何日志数据（无论是通过 syslog() 、日志本机记录还是 stdout/stderr 记录）都将由 systemd-journald@.service 模板单元的一个实例收集和处理，该模板单元管理指定的命名空间。日志数据存储在一个独立于默认日志命名空间数据存储的数据存储中。有关日志命名空间的详细信息，请参阅 systemd-journald.service(8)。

Internally, journal namespaces are implemented through Linux mount namespacing and over-mounting the directory that contains the relevant AF_UNIX sockets used for logging in the unit's mount namespace. Since mount namespaces are used this setting disconnects propagation of mounts from the unit's processes to the host, similarly to how ReadOnlyPaths= and similar settings describe above work. Journal namespaces may hence not be used for services that need to establish mount points on the host.
在内部，日志命名空间是通过 Linux 挂载命名空间实现的，并通过在包含用于在单元的挂载命名空间中记录日志的 AF_UNIX 套接字的目录上进行挂载来实现。由于使用了挂载命名空间，此设置会断开从单元的进程到主机的挂载传播，类似于上述 ReadOnlyPaths= 和类似设置的工作方式。因此，日志命名空间可能无法用于需要在主机上建立挂载点的服务。

When this option is used the unit will automatically gain ordering and requirement dependencies on the two socket units associated with the systemd-journald@.service instance so that they are automatically established prior to the unit starting up. Note that when this option is used log output of this service does not appear in the regular journalctl(1) output, unless the --namespace= option is used.
当使用此选项时，单元将自动在与 systemd-journald@.service 实例关联的两个套接字单元上获得排序和需求依赖关系，以便它们在单元启动之前自动建立。请注意，当使用此选项时，此服务的日志输出不会出现在常规 journalctl(1)输出中，除非使用 --namespace= 选项。

This option is only available for system services and is not supported for services running in per-user instances of the service manager.
此选项仅适用于系统服务，并不支持在服务管理器的每个用户实例中运行的服务。

Added in version 245. 在版本 245 中添加。

SyslogIdentifier=¶

Sets the process name ("syslog tag") to prefix log lines sent to the logging system or the kernel log buffer with. If not set, defaults to the process name of the executed process. This option is only useful when StandardOutput= or StandardError= are set to journal or kmsg (or to the same settings in combination with +console) and only applies to log messages written to stdout or stderr.
将进程名称（“syslog 标记”）设置为前缀，用于发送到日志系统或内核日志缓冲区的日志行。如果未设置，默认为执行进程的进程名称。仅当 StandardOutput= 或 StandardError= 设置为 journal 或 kmsg （或与 +console 结合使用相同设置时）时才有用，并且仅适用于写入 stdout 或 stderr 的日志消息。

SyslogFacility=¶

Sets the syslog facility identifier to use when logging. One of kern, user, mail, daemon, auth, syslog, lpr, news, uucp, cron, authpriv, ftp, local0, local1, local2, local3, local4, local5, local6 or local7. See syslog(3) for details. This option is only useful when StandardOutput= or StandardError= are set to journal or kmsg (or to the same settings in combination with +console), and only applies to log messages written to stdout or stderr. Defaults to daemon.
设置用于记录时要使用的 syslog 设施标识符。其中之一为 kern ， user ， mail ， daemon ， auth ， syslog ， lpr ， news ， uucp ， cron ， authpriv ， ftp ， local0 ， local1 ， local2 ， local3 ， local4 ， local5 ， local6 或 local7 。有关详细信息，请参阅 syslog(3)。仅当 StandardOutput= 或 StandardError= 设置为 journal 或 kmsg （或与 +console 结合使用相同设置时）才有用，并且仅适用于写入 stdout 或 stderr 的日志消息。默认为 daemon 。

SyslogLevel=¶

The default syslog log level to use when logging to the logging system or the kernel log buffer. One of emerg, alert, crit, err, warning, notice, info, debug. See syslog(3) for details. This option is only useful when StandardOutput= or StandardError= are set to journal or kmsg (or to the same settings in combination with +console), and only applies to log messages written to stdout or stderr. Note that individual lines output by executed processes may be prefixed with a different log level which can be used to override the default log level specified here. The interpretation of these prefixes may be disabled with SyslogLevelPrefix=, see below. For details, see sd-daemon(3). Defaults to info.
在记录到日志系统或内核日志缓冲区时使用的默认 syslog 日志级别。其中之一为 emerg ， alert ， crit ， err ， warning ， notice ， info ， debug 。有关详细信息，请参阅 syslog(3)。此选项仅在 StandardOutput= 或 StandardError= 设置为 journal 或 kmsg （或与 +console 相同设置的组合）时才有用，并且仅适用于写入 stdout 或 stderr 的日志消息。请注意，由执行的进程输出的各行可能以不同的日志级别为前缀，该前缀可用于覆盖此处指定的默认日志级别。这些前缀的解释可能已使用 SyslogLevelPrefix= 禁用，请参见下文。有关详细信息，请参阅 sd-daemon(3)。默认为 info 。

SyslogLevelPrefix=¶

Takes a boolean argument. If true and StandardOutput= or StandardError= are set to journal or kmsg (or to the same settings in combination with +console), log lines written by the executed process that are prefixed with a log level will be processed with this log level set but the prefix removed. If set to false, the interpretation of these prefixes is disabled and the logged lines are passed on as-is. This only applies to log messages written to stdout or stderr. For details about this prefixing see sd-daemon(3). Defaults to true.
接受一个布尔参数。如果为 true，并且 StandardOutput= 或 StandardError= 设置为 journal 或 kmsg （或与 +console 相同设置的组合），则由执行的进程编写的带有日志级别前缀的日志行将使用此日志级别进行处理，但前缀将被删除。如果设置为 false，则禁用这些前缀的解释，并且记录的行将按原样传递。这仅适用于写入 stdout 或 stderr 的日志消息。有关此前缀的详细信息，请参阅 sd-daemon(3)。默认为 true。

TTYPath=¶

Sets the terminal device node to use if standard input, output, or error are connected to a TTY (see above). Defaults to /dev/console.
如果标准输入、输出或错误连接到 TTY（见上文），则设置要使用的终端设备节点。默认为 /dev/console 。

TTYReset=¶

Reset the terminal device specified with TTYPath= before and after execution. Defaults to "no".
在执行前后重置指定的终端设备 TTYPath= 。默认为 " no " 。

TTYVHangup=¶

Disconnect all clients which have opened the terminal device specified with TTYPath= before and after execution. Defaults to "no".
在执行前后断开所有已打开指定终端设备 TTYPath= 的客户端。默认为 " no " 。

TTYRows=, TTYColumns=¶  TTYRows= ， TTYColumns= ¶

Configure the size of the TTY specified with TTYPath=. If unset or set to the empty string, the kernel default is used.
配置使用 TTYPath= 指定的 TTY 的大小。如果未设置或设置为空字符串，则使用内核默认值。

Added in version 250. 添加在版本 250 中。

TTYVTDisallocate=¶

If the terminal device specified with TTYPath= is a virtual console terminal, try to deallocate the TTY before and after execution. This ensures that the screen and scrollback buffer is cleared. Defaults to "no".
如果使用 TTYPath= 指定的终端设备是虚拟控制台终端，请尝试在执行前后释放 TTY。这可以确保屏幕和滚动缓冲区被清除。默认为 " no "。

Credentials¶ 凭据

LoadCredential=ID[:PATH], LoadCredentialEncrypted=ID[:PATH]¶

Pass a credential to the unit. Credentials are limited-size binary or textual objects that may be passed to unit processes. They are primarily used for passing cryptographic keys (both public and private) or certificates, user account information or identity information from host to services. The data is accessible from the unit's processes via the file system, at a read-only location that (if possible and permitted) is backed by non-swappable memory. The data is only accessible to the user associated with the unit, via the User=/DynamicUser= settings (as well as the superuser). When available, the location of credentials is exported as the $CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY environment variable to the unit's processes.
将凭证传递给单元。 凭证是有限大小的二进制或文本对象，可以传递给单元进程。 它们主要用于从主机向服务传递加密密钥（公钥和私钥）、证书、用户帐户信息或身份信息。 数据可以通过文件系统从单元的进程访问，位于只读位置，如果可能和允许的话，由不可交换的内存支持。 数据仅对与单元关联的用户可访问，通过 User= / DynamicUser= 设置（以及超级用户）。 可用时，凭证的位置将作为 $CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY 环境变量导出给单元的进程。

The LoadCredential= setting takes a textual ID to use as name for a credential plus a file system path, separated by a colon. The ID must be a short ASCII string suitable as filename in the filesystem, and may be chosen freely by the user. If the specified path is absolute it is opened as regular file and the credential data is read from it. If the absolute path refers to an AF_UNIX stream socket in the file system a connection is made to it (only once at unit start-up) and the credential data read from the connection, providing an easy IPC integration point for dynamically transferring credentials from other services.
LoadCredential= 设置需要一个文本 ID 作为凭据名称，以及一个文件系统路径，两者用冒号分隔。ID 必须是一个适合作为文件系统中文件名的短 ASCII 字符串，并且可以由用户自由选择。如果指定的路径是绝对路径，则会打开为常规文件，并从中读取凭据数据。如果绝对路径指向文件系统中的 AF_UNIX 流套接字，则会与其建立连接（仅在单元启动时一次），并从连接中读取凭据数据，提供了一个易于 IPC 集成点，用于动态地从其他服务传输凭据。

If the specified path is not absolute and itself qualifies as valid credential identifier it is attempted to find a credential that the service manager itself received under the specified name — which may be used to propagate credentials from an invoking environment (e.g. a container manager that invoked the service manager) into a service. If no matching system credential is found, the directories /etc/credstore/, /run/credstore/ and /usr/lib/credstore/ are searched for files under the credential's name — which hence are recommended locations for credential data on disk. If LoadCredentialEncrypted= is used /run/credstore.encrypted/, /etc/credstore.encrypted/, and /usr/lib/credstore.encrypted/ are searched as well.
如果指定的路径不是绝对路径，并且本身符合有效凭据标识符的条件，则尝试查找服务管理器本身在指定名称下接收的凭据，这些凭据可用于将凭据从调用环境（例如调用服务管理器的容器管理器）传播到服务中。如果找不到匹配的系统凭据，则会在凭据名称下搜索目录 /etc/credstore/ ， /run/credstore/ 和 /usr/lib/credstore/ 中的文件，因此这些位置是磁盘上凭据数据的推荐位置。如果使用 LoadCredentialEncrypted= ，还会搜索 /run/credstore.encrypted/ ， /etc/credstore.encrypted/ 和 /usr/lib/credstore.encrypted/ 。

If the file system path is omitted it is chosen identical to the credential name, i.e. this is a terse way to declare credentials to inherit from the service manager into a service. This option may be used multiple times, each time defining an additional credential to pass to the unit.
如果省略文件系统路径，则选择与凭据名称相同，即这是一种简洁的方式声明要从服务管理器继承到服务中的凭据。可以多次使用此选项，每次定义要传递给单元的附加凭据。

If an absolute path referring to a directory is specified, every file in that directory (recursively) will be loaded as a separate credential. The ID for each credential will be the provided ID suffixed with "_$FILENAME" (e.g., "Key_file1"). When loading from a directory, symlinks will be ignored.
如果指定了指向目录的绝对路径，则该目录中的每个文件（递归地）将被加载为单独的凭据。每个凭据的 ID 将是提供的 ID 后缀为" _$FILENAME "（例如，" Key_file1 "）。从目录加载时，符号链接将被忽略。

The contents of the file/socket may be arbitrary binary or textual data, including newline characters and NUL bytes.
文件/套接字的内容可以是任意的二进制或文本数据，包括换行符和 NUL 字节。

The LoadCredentialEncrypted= setting is identical to LoadCredential=, except that the credential data is decrypted and authenticated before being passed on to the executed processes. Specifically, the referenced path should refer to a file or socket with an encrypted credential, as implemented by systemd-creds(1). This credential is loaded, decrypted, authenticated and then passed to the application in plaintext form, in the same way a regular credential specified via LoadCredential= would be. A credential configured this way may be symmetrically encrypted/authenticated with a secret key derived from the system's TPM2 security chip, or with a secret key stored in /var/lib/systemd/credentials.secret, or with both. Using encrypted and authenticated credentials improves security as credentials are not stored in plaintext and only authenticated and decrypted into plaintext the moment a service requiring them is started. Moreover, credentials may be bound to the local hardware and installations, so that they cannot easily be analyzed offline, or be generated externally. When DevicePolicy= is set to "closed" or "strict", or set to "auto" and DeviceAllow= is set, or PrivateDevices= is set, then this setting adds /dev/tpmrm0 with rw mode to DeviceAllow=. See systemd.resource-control(5) for the details about DevicePolicy= or DeviceAllow=.
LoadCredentialEncrypted= 设置与 LoadCredential= 相同，唯一的区别是在传递给执行进程之前，凭据数据会被解密和验证。具体来说，引用的路径应该指向一个带有加密凭据的文件或套接字，这是由 systemd-creds(1)实现的。这个凭据会被加载、解密、验证，然后以明文形式传递给应用程序，就像通过 LoadCredential= 指定的常规凭据一样。以这种方式配置的凭据可以使用从系统的 TPM2 安全芯片派生的秘密密钥进行对称加密/验证，或者使用存储在 /var/lib/systemd/credentials.secret 中的秘密密钥，或者两者兼而有之。使用加密和验证的凭据可以提高安全性，因为凭据不会以明文形式存储，只有在启动需要这些凭据的服务时才会被验证和解密为明文。此外，凭据可以绑定到本地硬件和安装，这样它们就不能轻易被离线分析或外部生成。当 DevicePolicy= 设置为" closed "或" strict "，或设置为" auto "并且 DeviceAllow= 已设置，或 PrivateDevices= 已设置时，此设置将 /dev/tpmrm0 添加到 DeviceAllow= 的 rw 模式中。请参阅 systemd。有关 DevicePolicy= 或 DeviceAllow= 的详细信息，请参阅 resource-control(5) 。

The credential files/IPC sockets must be accessible to the service manager, but don't have to be directly accessible to the unit's processes: the credential data is read and copied into separate, read-only copies for the unit that are accessible to appropriately privileged processes. This is particularly useful in combination with DynamicUser= as this way privileged data can be made available to processes running under a dynamic UID (i.e. not a previously known one) without having to open up access to all users.
凭证文件/IPC 套接字必须对服务管理器可访问，但不必直接对单元的进程可访问：凭证数据将被读取并复制到单元的各自只读副本中，这些副本可供适当特权的进程访问。这在与 DynamicUser= 结合使用时特别有用，因为这样可以使特权数据可供在动态 UID（即非先前已知 UID）下运行的进程使用，而无需开放给所有用户。

In order to reference the path a credential may be read from within a ExecStart= command line use "${CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY}/mycred", e.g. "ExecStart=cat ${CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY}/mycred". In order to reference the path a credential may be read from within a Environment= line use "%d/mycred", e.g. "Environment=MYCREDPATH=%d/mycred". For system services the path may also be referenced as "/run/credentials/UNITNAME" in cases where no interpolation is possible, e.g. configuration files of software that does not yet support credentials natively. $CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY is considered the primary interface to look for credentials, though, since it also works for user services.
为了在 ExecStart= 命令行中引用凭证可能被读取的路径，请使用“ ${CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY}/mycred ”，例如“ ExecStart=cat ${CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY}/mycred ”。为了在 Environment= 行中引用凭证可能被读取的路径，请使用“ %d/mycred ”，例如“ Environment=MYCREDPATH=%d/mycred ”。对于系统服务，路径也可以被引用为“ /run/credentials/UNITNAME ”，在无法进行插值的情况下使用，例如尚不支持凭证的软件的配置文件。 $CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY 被认为是寻找凭证的主要接口，因为它也适用于用户服务。

Currently, an accumulated credential size limit of 1 MB per unit is enforced.
目前，每个单元强制执行 1 MB 的累积凭据大小限制。

The service manager itself may receive system credentials that can be propagated to services from a hosting container manager or VM hypervisor. See the Container Interface documentation for details about the former. For the latter, pass DMI/SMBIOS OEM string table entries (field type 11) with a prefix of "io.systemd.credential:" or "io.systemd.credential.binary:". In both cases a key/value pair separated by "=" is expected, in the latter case the right-hand side is Base64 decoded when parsed (thus permitting binary data to be passed in). Example qemu switch: "-smbios type=11,value=io.systemd.credential:xx=yy", or "-smbios type=11,value=io.systemd.credential.binary:rick=TmV2ZXIgR29ubmEgR2l2ZSBZb3UgVXA=". Alternatively, use the qemu "fw_cfg" node "opt/io.systemd.credentials/". Example qemu switch: "-fw_cfg name=opt/io.systemd.credentials/mycred,string=supersecret". They may also be passed from the UEFI firmware environment via systemd-stub(7), from the initrd (see systemd(1)), or be specified on the kernel command line using the "systemd.set_credential=" and "systemd.set_credential_binary=" switches (see systemd(1) – this is not recommended since unprivileged userspace can read the kernel command line).
服务管理器本身可能会接收可以从托管容器管理器或 VM 虚拟机监视程序传播到服务的系统凭据。有关前者的详细信息，请参阅容器接口文档。对于后者，请传递带有前缀 " io.systemd.credential: " 或 " io.systemd.credential.binary: " 的 DMI/SMBIOS OEM 字符串表条目（字段类型 11），在两种情况下，期望由 " = " 分隔的键/值对，后一种情况下，解析时右侧会进行 Base64 解码（从而允许传递二进制数据）。示例 qemu 开关：" -smbios type=11,value=io.systemd.credential:xx=yy "，或" -smbios type=11,value=io.systemd.credential.binary:rick=TmV2ZXIgR29ubmEgR2l2ZSBZb3UgVXA= "。或者，使用 qemu " fw_cfg " 节点" opt/io.systemd.credentials/ "。示例 qemu 开关：" -fw_cfg name=opt/io.systemd.credentials/mycred,string=supersecret "。它们也可以通过 systemd-stub(7) 从 UEFI 固件环境传递，从 initrd（请参阅 systemd(1)），或者在内核命令行上使用 " systemd.set_credential= " 和 " systemd.set_credential_binary= " 开关指定（请参阅 systemd(1) - 不建议这样做，因为非特权用户空间可以读取内核命令行）。

If referencing an AF_UNIX stream socket to connect to, the connection will originate from an abstract namespace socket, that includes information about the unit and the credential ID in its socket name. Use getpeername(2) to query this information. The returned socket name is formatted as NUL RANDOM "/unit/" UNIT "/" ID, i.e. a NUL byte (as required for abstract namespace socket names), followed by a random string (consisting of alphadecimal characters), followed by the literal string "/unit/", followed by the requesting unit name, followed by the literal character "/", followed by the textual credential ID requested. Example: "\0adf9d86b6eda275e/unit/foobar.service/credx" in case the credential "credx" is requested for a unit "foobar.service". This functionality is useful for using a single listening socket to serve credentials to multiple consumers.
如果引用一个 AF_UNIX 流套接字进行连接，连接将起源于一个抽象命名空间套接字，其中包含有关单元和凭证 ID 的信息在其套接字名称中。使用 getpeername(2) 查询此信息。返回的套接字名称格式为 NUL RANDOM " /unit/ " UNIT " / " ID ，即一个 NUL 字节（用于抽象命名空间套接字名称所需的字节数），后跟一个随机字符串（由字母数字字符组成），后跟字面字符串 " /unit/ "，后跟请求单元名称，后跟字面字符 " / "，后跟请求的文本凭证 ID。示例：" \0adf9d86b6eda275e/unit/foobar.service/credx "，如果请求单元 " credx " 的凭证为 " foobar.service "。此功能可用于使用单个监听套接字为多个使用者提供凭证。

For further information see System and Service Credentials documentation.
有关更多信息，请参阅系统和服务凭证文档。

Added in version 247. 添加于版本 247。

ImportCredential=GLOB¶

Pass one or more credentials to the unit. Takes a credential name for which we'll attempt to find a credential that the service manager itself received under the specified name — which may be used to propagate credentials from an invoking environment (e.g. a container manager that invoked the service manager) into a service. If the credential name is a glob, all credentials matching the glob are passed to the unit. Matching credentials are searched for in the system credentials, the encrypted system credentials, and under /etc/credstore/, /run/credstore/, /usr/lib/credstore/, /run/credstore.encrypted/, /etc/credstore.encrypted/, and /usr/lib/credstore.encrypted/ in that order. When multiple credentials of the same name are found, the first one found is used.
将一个或多个凭据传递给单元。接受一个凭据名称，我们将尝试查找服务管理器本身在指定名称下接收的凭据，这些凭据可以用于将凭据从调用环境（例如调用服务管理器的容器管理器）传播到服务中。如果凭据名称是一个通配符，那么将传递匹配该通配符的所有凭据给单元。匹配的凭据将按照系统凭据、加密的系统凭据以及依次在 /etc/credstore/ 、 /run/credstore/ 、 /usr/lib/credstore/ 、 /run/credstore.encrypted/ 、 /etc/credstore.encrypted/ 和 /usr/lib/credstore.encrypted/ 下进行搜索。当找到多个同名凭据时，将使用找到的第一个凭据。

The globbing expression implements a restrictive subset of glob(7): only a single trailing "*" wildcard may be specified. Both "?" and "[]" wildcards are not permitted, nor are "*" wildcards anywhere except at the end of the glob expression.
通配符表达式实现了 glob(7) 的一种受限子集：只能指定一个单个的尾部" * "通配符。既不允许使用" ? "和" [] "通配符，也不允许在通配符表达式中除了在末尾之外的任何位置使用" * "通配符。

When multiple credentials of the same name are found, credentials found by LoadCredential= and LoadCredentialEncrypted= take priority over credentials found by ImportCredential=.
当找到多个同名凭据时，由 LoadCredential= 和 LoadCredentialEncrypted= 找到的凭据优先于由 ImportCredential= 找到的凭据。

Added in version 254. 在版本 254 中添加。

SetCredential=ID:VALUE, SetCredentialEncrypted=ID:VALUE¶
SetCredential= ID ： VALUE ， SetCredentialEncrypted= ID ： VALUE ¶

The SetCredential= setting is similar to LoadCredential= but accepts a literal value to use as data for the credential, instead of a file system path to read the data from. Do not use this option for data that is supposed to be secret, as it is accessible to unprivileged processes via IPC. It's only safe to use this for user IDs, public key material and similar non-sensitive data. For everything else use LoadCredential=. In order to embed binary data into the credential data use C-style escaping (i.e. "\n" to embed a newline, or "\x00" to embed a NUL byte).
" SetCredential= " 设置类似于 " LoadCredential= "，但接受用作凭据数据的文字值，而不是从文件系统路径读取数据。不要将此选项用于应该保密的数据，因为通过 IPC 可以访问非特权进程。只有对用户 ID、公钥材料和类似的非敏感数据使用才安全。对于其他所有内容，请使用 " LoadCredential= "。为了将二进制数据嵌入凭据数据中，请使用 C 风格转义（即 " \n " 以嵌入换行，或 " \x00 " 以嵌入 NUL 字节）。

The SetCredentialEncrypted= setting is identical to SetCredential= but expects an encrypted credential in literal form as value. This allows embedding confidential credentials securely directly in unit files. Use systemd-creds(1)' -p switch to generate suitable SetCredentialEncrypted= lines directly from plaintext credentials. For further details see LoadCredentialEncrypted= above.
" SetCredentialEncrypted= " 设置与 " SetCredential= " 完全相同，但期望以文字形式作为值的加密凭据。这允许将机密凭据安全地直接嵌入到单元文件中。使用 systemd-creds(1) 的 " -p " 开关直接从明文凭据生成适当的 SetCredentialEncrypted= 行。有关更多详细信息，请参阅上述 LoadCredentialEncrypted= 。

When multiple credentials of the same name are found, credentials found by LoadCredential=, LoadCredentialEncrypted= and ImportCredential= take priority over credentials found by SetCredential=. As such, SetCredential= will act as default if no credentials are found by any of the former. In this case not being able to retrieve the credential from the path specified in LoadCredential= or LoadCredentialEncrypted= is not considered fatal.
当发现同名的多个凭据时，由 LoadCredential= ， LoadCredentialEncrypted= 和 ImportCredential= 发现的凭据优先于由 SetCredential= 发现的凭据。因此，如果前者中没有发现凭据，则 SetCredential= 将充当默认值。在这种情况下，无法从 LoadCredential= 或 LoadCredentialEncrypted= 中指定的路径检索凭据不被视为致命。

Added in version 247. 添加在版本 247 中。

System V Compatibility¶ System V 兼容性。

UtmpIdentifier=¶

Takes a four character identifier string for an utmp(5) and wtmp entry for this service. This should only be set for services such as getty implementations (such as agetty(8)) where utmp/wtmp entries must be created and cleared before and after execution, or for services that shall be executed as if they were run by a getty process (see below). If the configured string is longer than four characters, it is truncated and the terminal four characters are used. This setting interprets %I style string replacements. This setting is unset by default, i.e. no utmp/wtmp entries are created or cleaned up for this service.
接受一个四个字符的标识符字符串，用于此服务的 utmp(5) 和 wtmp 条目。这应该仅设置为诸如 getty 实现（例如 agetty(8)）之类的服务，其中必须在执行前后创建和清除 utmp/wtmp 条目，或者对应于应当像 getty 进程运行的服务。如果配置的字符串长于四个字符，则会被截断，并使用最后四个字符。此设置解释 %I 样式字符串替换。默认情况下取消设置此设置，即不为此服务创建或清理 utmp/wtmp 条目。

UtmpMode=¶

Takes one of "init", "login" or "user". If UtmpIdentifier= is set, controls which type of utmp(5)/wtmp entries for this service are generated. This setting has no effect unless UtmpIdentifier= is set too. If "init" is set, only an INIT_PROCESS entry is generated and the invoked process must implement a getty-compatible utmp/wtmp logic. If "login" is set, first an INIT_PROCESS entry, followed by a LOGIN_PROCESS entry is generated. In this case, the invoked process must implement a login(1)-compatible utmp/wtmp logic. If "user" is set, first an INIT_PROCESS entry, then a LOGIN_PROCESS entry and finally a USER_PROCESS entry is generated. In this case, the invoked process may be any process that is suitable to be run as session leader. Defaults to "init".
接受 " init "、" login " 或 " user " 中的一个。如果设置了 UtmpIdentifier= ，则控制为该服务生成哪种类型的 utmp(5)/wtmp 条目。除非也设置了 UtmpIdentifier= ，否则此设置无效。如果设置了 " init "，则只生成一个 INIT_PROCESS 条目，并且调用的进程必须实现一个与 getty 兼容的 utmp/wtmp 逻辑。如果设置了 " login "，则首先生成一个 INIT_PROCESS 条目，然后是一个 LOGIN_PROCESS 条目。在这种情况下，调用的进程必须实现一个与 login(1) 兼容的 utmp/wtmp 逻辑。如果设置了 " user "，则首先生成一个 INIT_PROCESS 条目，然后是一个 LOGIN_PROCESS 条目，最后是一个 USER_PROCESS 条目。在这种情况下，调用的进程可以是适合作为会话领导者运行的任何进程。默认为 " init "。

Added in version 225. 在版本 225 中添加。

Environment Variables in Spawned Processes¶
在生成的进程中的环境变量。

Processes started by the service manager are executed with an environment variable block assembled from multiple sources. Processes started by the system service manager generally do not inherit environment variables set for the service manager itself (but this may be altered via PassEnvironment=), but processes started by the user service manager instances generally do inherit all environment variables set for the service manager itself.
由服务管理器启动的进程将使用从多个来源组装而成的环境变量块执行。通常情况下，由系统服务管理器启动的进程不会继承为服务管理器本身设置的环境变量（但可以通过 PassEnvironment= 进行更改），但由用户服务管理器实例启动的进程通常会继承为服务管理器本身设置的所有环境变量。

For each invoked process the list of environment variables set is compiled from the following sources:
对于每个调用的进程，设置的环境变量列表是从以下来源编制的：

  • Variables globally configured for the service manager, using the DefaultEnvironment= setting in systemd-system.conf(5), the kernel command line option systemd.setenv= understood by systemd(1), or via systemctl(1) set-environment verb.
    为服务管理器全局配置的变量，使用 systemd-system.conf(5)中的 DefaultEnvironment= 设置，systemd(1)可理解的内核命令行选项 systemd.setenv= ，或通过 systemctl(1)的 set-environment 命令。

  • Variables defined by the service manager itself (see the list below).
    由服务管理器本身定义的变量（请参见下面的列表）。

  • Variables set in the service manager's own environment variable block (subject to PassEnvironment= for the system service manager).
    在服务管理器自己的环境变量块中设置的变量（受系统服务管理器的 PassEnvironment= 限制）。

  • Variables set via Environment= in the unit file.
    通过单位文件中的 Environment= 设置的变量。

  • Variables read from files specified via EnvironmentFile= in the unit file.
    从单元文件中通过 EnvironmentFile= 指定的文件读取的变量。

  • Variables set by any PAM modules in case PAMName= is in effect, cf. pam_env(8).
    如果 PAMName= 生效，则由任何 PAM 模块设置的变量，参见 pam_env(8)。

If the same environment variable is set by multiple of these sources, the later source — according to the order of the list above — wins. Note that as the final step all variables listed in UnsetEnvironment= are removed from the compiled environment variable list, immediately before it is passed to the executed process.
如果同一环境变量由这些来源中的多个设置，那么根据上面列表的顺序，后来的来源获胜。请注意，作为最后一步，在传递给执行的进程之前，将从编译的环境变量列表中删除 UnsetEnvironment= 中列出的所有变量。

The general philosophy is to expose a small curated list of environment variables to processes. Services started by the system manager (PID 1) will be started, without additional service-specific configuration, with just a few environment variables. The user manager inherits environment variables as any other system service, but in addition may receive additional environment variables from PAM, and, typically, additional imported variables when the user starts a graphical session. It is recommended to keep the environment blocks in both the system and user managers lean. Importing all variables inherited by the graphical session or by one of the user shells is strongly discouraged.
一般的哲学是向进程公开一小部分经过精心筛选的环境变量。由系统管理器（PID 1）启动的服务将仅使用少量环境变量启动，而无需额外的服务特定配置。用户管理器会像其他系统服务一样继承环境变量，但还可能从 PAM 接收额外的环境变量，并且通常在用户启动图形会话时会接收到额外导入的变量。建议保持系统管理器和用户管理器中的环境块精简。强烈建议不要导入由图形会话或用户其中一个 shell 继承的所有变量。

Hint: systemd-run -P env and systemd-run --user -P env print the effective system and user service environment blocks.
提示：systemd-run -P env 和 systemd-run --user -P env 可打印出有效的系统和用户服务环境块。

Environment Variables Set or Propagated by the Service Manager¶
由服务管理器设置或传播的环境变量。

The following environment variables are propagated by the service manager or generated internally for each invoked process:
服务管理器传播的环境变量或为每个调用的进程内部生成的如下：

$PATH¶

Colon-separated list of directories to use when launching executables. systemd uses a fixed value of "/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin" in the system manager. In case of the user manager, a different path may be configured by the distribution. It is recommended to not rely on the order of entries, and have only one program with a given name in $PATH.
在启动可执行文件时使用的目录的冒号分隔列表。systemd 在系统管理器中使用固定值“ /usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin ”。在用户管理器中，可以由发行版配置不同的路径。建议不依赖条目的顺序，并且在 $PATH 中只有一个给定名称的程序。

Added in version 208. 在版本 208 中添加。

$LANG¶

Locale. Can be set in locale.conf(5) or on the kernel command line (see systemd(1) and kernel-command-line(7)).
区域设置。可以在 locale.conf(5)或内核命令行中设置（参见 systemd(1)和 kernel-command-line(7)）。

Added in version 208.
自版本 208 中添加。

$USER, $LOGNAME, $HOME, $SHELL¶
$USER ， $LOGNAME ， $HOME ， $SHELL ¶

User name (twice), home directory, and the login shell. $USER is set unconditionally, while $HOME, $LOGNAME, and $SHELL are only set for the units that have User= set and SetLoginEnvironment= unset or set to true. For user services, these variables are typically inherited from the user manager itself. See passwd(5).
用户名称（两次）、主目录和登录 shell。 $USER 被无条件设置，而 $HOME 、 $LOGNAME 和 $SHELL 仅对已设置 User= 且 SetLoginEnvironment= 未设置或设置为 true 的单元进行设置。对于用户服务，这些变量通常从用户管理器本身继承。参见 passwd(5)。

Added in version 208.
在版本 208 中添加。

$INVOCATION_ID¶

Contains a randomized, unique 128-bit ID identifying each runtime cycle of the unit, formatted as 32 character hexadecimal string. A new ID is assigned each time the unit changes from an inactive state into an activating or active state, and may be used to identify this specific runtime cycle, in particular in data stored offline, such as the journal. The same ID is passed to all processes run as part of the unit.
包含一个随机的、唯一的 128 位 ID，用于标识单位的每个运行周期，格式为 32 个字符的十六进制字符串。每次单位从非活动状态转换为激活或活动状态时，都会分配一个新的 ID，并且可以用于识别此特定运行周期，特别是在离线存储的数据中，如日志。相同的 ID 将传递给作为单位一部分运行的所有进程。

Added in version 232. 在版本 232 中添加。

$XDG_RUNTIME_DIR¶

The directory to use for runtime objects (such as IPC objects) and volatile state. Set for all services run by the user systemd instance, as well as any system services that use PAMName= with a PAM stack that includes pam_systemd. See below and pam_systemd(8) for more information.
用于运行时对象（如 IPC 对象）和易失性状态的目录。为用户 systemd 实例运行的所有服务设置，以及使用包含 pam_systemd 的 PAM 堆栈的任何系统服务。有关更多信息，请参见下文和 pam_systemd(8)。

Added in version 208. 在版本 208 中添加。

$RUNTIME_DIRECTORY, $STATE_DIRECTORY, $CACHE_DIRECTORY, $LOGS_DIRECTORY, $CONFIGURATION_DIRECTORY¶
$RUNTIME_DIRECTORY ， $STATE_DIRECTORY ， $CACHE_DIRECTORY ， $LOGS_DIRECTORY ， $CONFIGURATION_DIRECTORY ¶

Absolute paths to the directories defined with RuntimeDirectory=, StateDirectory=, CacheDirectory=, LogsDirectory=, and ConfigurationDirectory= when those settings are used.
绝对路径到使用 RuntimeDirectory= ， StateDirectory= ， CacheDirectory= ， LogsDirectory= 和 ConfigurationDirectory= 定义的目录时，当这些设置被使用时。

Added in version 244. 在版本 244 中添加。

$CREDENTIALS_DIRECTORY¶

An absolute path to the per-unit directory with credentials configured via ImportCredential=/LoadCredential=/SetCredential=. The directory is marked read-only and is placed in unswappable memory (if supported and permitted), and is only accessible to the UID associated with the unit via User= or DynamicUser= (and the superuser).
通过 ImportCredential= / LoadCredential= / SetCredential= 配置的每单元目录的绝对路径。该目录被标记为只读，并放置在不可交换的内存中（如果支持且允许），仅可通过与单元关联的 UID 通过 User= 或 DynamicUser= （以及超级用户）访问。

Added in version 247. 在版本 247 中添加。

$MAINPID¶

The PID of the unit's main process if it is known. This is only set for control processes as invoked by ExecReload= and similar.
如果已知，这是单位主进程的 PID。仅对由 ExecReload= 等调用的控制进程设置。

Added in version 209. 在版本 209 中添加。

$MANAGERPID¶

The PID of the user systemd instance, set for processes spawned by it.
用户 systemd 实例的 PID，由它生成的进程设置。

Added in version 208. 在版本 208 中添加。

$LISTEN_FDS, $LISTEN_PID, $LISTEN_FDNAMES¶
$LISTEN_FDS ， $LISTEN_PID ， $LISTEN_FDNAMES ¶

Information about file descriptors passed to a service for socket activation. See sd_listen_fds(3).
有关传递给服务以进行套接字激活的文件描述符的信息。请参阅 sd_listen_fds(3)。

Added in version 208.
自版本 208 中添加。

$NOTIFY_SOCKET¶

The socket sd_notify() talks to. See sd_notify(3).
与套接字 sd_notify() 通信。请参阅 sd_notify(3)。

Added in version 229.
在版本 229 中添加。

$WATCHDOG_PID, $WATCHDOG_USEC¶  $WATCHDOG_PID ， $WATCHDOG_USEC ¶

Information about watchdog keep-alive notifications. See sd_watchdog_enabled(3).
有关看门狗保持活动通知的信息。请参阅 sd_watchdog_enabled(3)。

Added in version 229.
在版本 229 中添加。

$SYSTEMD_EXEC_PID¶

The PID of the unit process (e.g. process invoked by ExecStart=). The child process can use this information to determine whether the process is directly invoked by the service manager or indirectly as a child of another process by comparing this value with the current PID (similarly to the scheme used in sd_listen_fds(3) with $LISTEN_PID and $LISTEN_FDS).
单元进程的 PID（例如，由 ExecStart= 调用的进程）。子进程可以使用此信息通过将此值与当前 PID 进行比较（类似于在 sd_listen_fds(3)中使用 $LISTEN_PID 和 $LISTEN_FDS 的方案）来确定进程是由服务管理器直接调用还是间接作为另一个进程的子进程。

Added in version 248. 在版本 248 中添加。

$TERM¶

Terminal type, set only for units connected to a terminal (StandardInput=tty, StandardOutput=tty, or StandardError=tty). See termcap(5).
终端类型，仅针对连接到终端的单元（ StandardInput=tty ， StandardOutput=tty 或 StandardError=tty ）设置。请参阅 termcap(5)。

Added in version 209.
添加在版本 209 中。

$LOG_NAMESPACE¶

Contains the name of the selected logging namespace when the LogNamespace= service setting is used.
当使用 LogNamespace= 服务设置时，包含所选日志命名空间的名称。

Added in version 246. 添加于版本 246。

$JOURNAL_STREAM¶

If the standard output or standard error output of the executed processes are connected to the journal (for example, by setting StandardError=journal) $JOURNAL_STREAM contains the device and inode numbers of the connection file descriptor, formatted in decimal, separated by a colon (":"). This permits invoked processes to safely detect whether their standard output or standard error output are connected to the journal. The device and inode numbers of the file descriptors should be compared with the values set in the environment variable to determine whether the process output is still connected to the journal. Note that it is generally not sufficient to only check whether $JOURNAL_STREAM is set at all as services might invoke external processes replacing their standard output or standard error output, without unsetting the environment variable.
如果执行的进程的标准输出或标准错误输出连接到日志（例如，通过设置 StandardError=journal ）， $JOURNAL_STREAM 包含连接文件描述符的设备和索引节点号，以十进制格式表示，用冒号（" : "）分隔。这允许调用的进程安全地检测它们的标准输出或标准错误输出是否连接到日志。应该将文件描述符的设备和索引节点号与环境变量中设置的值进行比较，以确定进程输出是否仍连接到日志。请注意，仅检查是否设置了 $JOURNAL_STREAM 可能不足够，因为服务可能调用替换其标准输出或标准错误输出的外部进程，而不取消设置环境变量。

If both standard output and standard error of the executed processes are connected to the journal via a stream socket, this environment variable will contain information about the standard error stream, as that's usually the preferred destination for log data. (Note that typically the same stream is used for both standard output and standard error, hence very likely the environment variable contains device and inode information matching both stream file descriptors.)
如果执行的进程的标准输出和标准错误都通过流套接字连接到日志，那么这个环境变量将包含有关标准错误流的信息，因为通常这是日志数据的首选目的地。（请注意，通常相同的流用于标准输出和标准错误，因此很可能环境变量包含与两个流文件描述符匹配的设备和索引节点信息。）

This environment variable is primarily useful to allow services to optionally upgrade their used log protocol to the native journal protocol (using sd_journal_print(3) and other functions) if their standard output or standard error output is connected to the journal anyway, thus enabling delivery of structured metadata along with logged messages.
如果服务的标准输出或标准错误输出已连接到日志，那么这个环境变量主要用于允许服务选择性地将其使用的日志协议升级为本机日志协议（使用 sd_journal_print(3)和其他函数），从而使结构化元数据与记录的消息一起传递。

Added in version 231. 添加于版本 231。

$SERVICE_RESULT¶

Only used for the service unit type. This environment variable is passed to all ExecStop= and ExecStopPost= processes, and encodes the service "result". Currently, the following values are defined:
仅用于服务单元类型。此环境变量传递给所有 ExecStop= 和 ExecStopPost= 进程，并对服务“结果”进行编码。目前，定义了以下值：

Table 5. Defined $SERVICE_RESULT values
表 5. 定义的 $SERVICE_RESULT 值

ValueMeaning
"success"  success The service ran successfully and exited cleanly.
服务成功运行并干净地退出。
"protocol"  protocol A protocol violation occurred: the service did not take the steps required by its unit configuration (specifically what is configured in its Type= setting).
发生了协议违规：服务未按照其单元配置所要求的步骤进行（具体来说是在其 Type= 设置中配置的内容）。
"timeout"  timeout One of the steps timed out.
其中一个步骤超时。
"exit-code"  exit-code Service process exited with a non-zero exit code; see $EXIT_CODE below for the actual exit code returned.
服务进程以非零退出代码退出；请查看下面的 $EXIT_CODE 以获取实际返回的退出代码。
"signal"  signal A service process was terminated abnormally by a signal, without dumping core. See $EXIT_CODE below for the actual signal causing the termination.
服务进程异常终止，未转储核心，通过信号终止。请参见下面的 $EXIT_CODE 以查看导致终止的实际信号。
"core-dump"  core-dump A service process terminated abnormally with a signal and dumped core. See $EXIT_CODE below for the signal causing the termination.
服务进程异常终止，并转储了核心。请参见下面的 $EXIT_CODE 以查看导致终止的信号。
"watchdog"  watchdog Watchdog keep-alive ping was enabled for the service, but the deadline was missed.
看门狗保持活动的服务启用了，但未能在截止日期前发送保持活动信号。
"exec-condition"  exec-condition Service did not run because ExecCondition= failed.
服务未运行，因为 ExecCondition= 失败。
"oom-kill"  oom-kill A service process was terminated by the Out-Of-Memory (OOM) killer.
服务进程被内存耗尽（OOM）杀手终止。
"start-limit-hit"  start-limit-hit A start limit was defined for the unit and it was hit, causing the unit to fail to start. See systemd.unit(5)'s StartLimitIntervalSec= and StartLimitBurst= for details.
为该单元定义了启动限制，并达到了限制，导致该单元无法启动。有关详细信息，请参阅 systemd.unit(5)的 StartLimitIntervalSec= 和 StartLimitBurst= 。
"resources"  resources A catch-all condition in case a system operation failed.
系统操作失败时的一个万能条件。

This environment variable is useful to monitor failure or successful termination of a service. Even though this variable is available in both ExecStop= and ExecStopPost=, it is usually a better choice to place monitoring tools in the latter, as the former is only invoked for services that managed to start up correctly, and the latter covers both services that failed during their start-up and those which failed during their runtime.
此环境变量对于监视服务的失败或成功终止非常有用。尽管此变量在 ExecStop= 和 ExecStopPost= 中都可用，但通常更好的选择是将监控工具放在后者，因为前者仅对成功启动的服务调用，而后者涵盖了在启动期间失败和在运行时失败的服务。

Added in version 232. 在版本 232 中添加。

$EXIT_CODE, $EXIT_STATUS¶  $EXIT_CODE ， $EXIT_STATUS ¶

Only defined for the service unit type. These environment variables are passed to all ExecStop=, ExecStopPost= processes and contain exit status/code information of the main process of the service. For the precise definition of the exit code and status, see wait(2). $EXIT_CODE is one of "exited", "killed", "dumped". $EXIT_STATUS contains the numeric exit code formatted as string if $EXIT_CODE is "exited", and the signal name in all other cases. Note that these environment variables are only set if the service manager succeeded to start and identify the main process of the service.
仅对服务单元类型定义。这些环境变量传递给所有 ExecStop= ， ExecStopPost= 进程，并包含服务主进程的退出状态/代码信息。有关退出代码和状态的精确定义，请参见 wait(2)。 $EXIT_CODE 是 " exited "、" killed "、" dumped " 之一。如果 $EXIT_CODE 是 " exited "，则 $EXIT_STATUS 包含格式化为字符串的数字退出代码，否则在所有其他情况下包含信号名称。请注意，仅当服务管理器成功启动并识别服务的主进程时，才设置这些环境变量。

Table 6. Summary of possible service result variable values
可能的服务结果变量值摘要表 6。

$SERVICE_RESULT$EXIT_CODE$EXIT_STATUS
"success"  success "killed"  killed "HUP", "INT", "TERM", "PIPE"
HUP "、" INT "、" TERM "、" PIPE
"exited"  exited "0"  0
"protocol"  protocol not set 未设置not set 未设置
"exited"  exited "0"  0
"timeout"  timeout "killed"  killed "TERM", "KILL"
TERM ", " KILL
"exited"  exited "0", "1", "2", "3", …, "255"
0 ", " 1 ", " 2 ", " 3 ", …, " 255
"exit-code"  exit-code "exited"  exited "1", "2", "3", …, "255"
1 ", " 2 ", " 3 ", …, " 255
"signal"  signal "killed"  killed "HUP", "INT", "KILL", …
"core-dump"  core-dump "dumped"  dumped "ABRT", "SEGV", "QUIT", …
"watchdog"  watchdog "dumped"  dumped "ABRT"  ABRT
"killed"  killed "TERM", "KILL"
TERM ", " KILL
"exited"  exited "0", "1", "2", "3", …, "255"
0 ", " 1 ", " 2 ", " 3 ", …, " 255
"exec-condition"  exec-condition "exited"  exited "1", "2", "3", "4", …, "254"
1 ", " 2 ", " 3 ", " 4 ", …, " 254
"oom-kill"  oom-kill "killed"  killed "TERM", "KILL"
TERM ", " KILL
"start-limit-hit"  start-limit-hit not set 未设置not set 未设置
"resources"  resources any of the above 以上任何一个any of the above 以上任何一个
Note: the process may be also terminated by a signal not sent by systemd. In particular the process may send an arbitrary signal to itself in a handler for any of the non-maskable signals. Nevertheless, in the "timeout" and "watchdog" rows above only the signals that systemd sends have been included. Moreover, using SuccessExitStatus= additional exit statuses may be declared to indicate clean termination, which is not reflected by this table.
注意：该进程也可能被非 systemd 发送的信号终止。特别是进程可能在任何不可屏蔽信号的处理程序中向自身发送任意信号。然而，在上述“ timeout ”和“ watchdog ”行中，仅包括 systemd 发送的信号。此外，可以使用 SuccessExitStatus= 额外的退出状态来指示干净的终止，这不在此表中反映。

Added in version 232. 自版本 232 中添加。

$MONITOR_SERVICE_RESULT, $MONITOR_EXIT_CODE, $MONITOR_EXIT_STATUS, $MONITOR_INVOCATION_ID, $MONITOR_UNIT¶
$MONITOR_SERVICE_RESULT ， $MONITOR_EXIT_CODE ， $MONITOR_EXIT_STATUS ， $MONITOR_INVOCATION_ID ， $MONITOR_UNIT ¶

Only defined for the service unit type. Those environment variables are passed to all ExecStart= and ExecStartPre= processes which run in services triggered by OnFailure= or OnSuccess= dependencies.
仅为服务单元类型定义。这些环境变量传递给由 OnFailure= 或 OnSuccess= 依赖项触发的所有 ExecStart= 和 ExecStartPre= 进程运行的服务。

Variables $MONITOR_SERVICE_RESULT, $MONITOR_EXIT_CODE and $MONITOR_EXIT_STATUS take the same values as for ExecStop= and ExecStopPost= processes. Variables $MONITOR_INVOCATION_ID and $MONITOR_UNIT are set to the invocation id and unit name of the service which triggered the dependency.
变量 $MONITOR_SERVICE_RESULT ， $MONITOR_EXIT_CODE 和 $MONITOR_EXIT_STATUS 与 ExecStop= 和 ExecStopPost= 进程的取值相同。变量 $MONITOR_INVOCATION_ID 和 $MONITOR_UNIT 被设置为触发依赖关系的服务的调用 ID 和单元名称。

Note that when multiple services trigger the same unit, those variables will be not be passed. Consider using a template handler unit for that case instead: "OnFailure=handler@%n.service" for non-templated units, or "OnFailure=handler@%p-%i.service" for templated units.
请注意，当多个服务触发相同的单元时，这些变量将不会被传递。考虑为该情况使用模板处理单元：对于非模板化单元使用 " OnFailure=handler@%n.service "，对于模板化单元使用 " OnFailure=handler@%p-%i.service "。

Added in version 251. 添加在版本 251 中。

$PIDFILE¶

The path to the configured PID file, in case the process is forked off on behalf of a service that uses the PIDFile= setting, see systemd.service(5) for details. Service code may use this environment variable to automatically generate a PID file at the location configured in the unit file. This field is set to an absolute path in the file system.
配置的 PID 文件路径，如果进程是代表使用 PIDFile= 设置的服务分叉出来的，请参阅 systemd.service(5) 以获取详细信息。服务代码可以使用此环境变量在单元文件中配置的位置自动生成 PID 文件。此字段设置为文件系统中的绝对路径。

Added in version 242. 添加在版本 242 中。

$REMOTE_ADDR, $REMOTE_PORT¶  $REMOTE_ADDR ， $REMOTE_PORT ¶
